name: Spider-Man
description: Sometimes student, sometimes scientist and sometimes photographer, Peter Parker is a full-time super hero better known as the web-slinging and wall-crawling Spider-Man. As an orphaned child, Peter was raised by his Uncle Ben and Aunt May. At a science expo, Peter was bitten by an errant radioactive spider which granted him an array of arachnid powers. He initially became Spider-Man to use his powers as an entertainer, growing so conceited he didn't bother stopping a passerby burglar. In a twist of fate, the same burglar wound up killing Peter's Uncle Ben, leading him to realize that he needed to use his powers responsibly. From then on, Spider-Man became a crime-fighting vigilante.
abilities: Spider-Sense: Spider-man can’t be attacked by surprise. He is immune to sneak attacks. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. When attacking an invisible character, Spider-man can estimate their location, so he doesn’t need a perception throw to attempt an attack. However, the attack is still thrown in disadvantage.
Web Swinging: As a bonus action, Spider-man can move 60 ft. with his web swinging ability. This can’t be done on a very open space.

Indomitable Will: As a result of a strong willpower, Spider-man has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He also gets a +5 bonus in any check when being telepathically controlled and he is immune to being charmed. He is immune to purple control.

Radioactive Immune System: Due to his accelerated metabolism and radioactive blood, Spider-Man has higher tolerance for drugs and diseases than normal humans, giving him an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist diseases, drug effects and overdoses. Also, he saves in advantage when trying to resist curse diseases, such as vampirism. It’s harder for him to get drunk, but he doesn’t drink too much anyways. He throws in advantage to save from paralysis and can’t be irradiated
Lesser Healing Factor: Spider-man can heal faster than an average human, allowing him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Bilingual: In addition to speaking English, Peter has also learned Mandarin.
weaknesses: Bad Luck: Peter Parker has suffered from a constant bad luck his entire life. For this reason, the GM can make a random Luck check for Spider-man from time to time. This can happen in any activity, even in a battle, and these checks can happen at the GM’s discretion while they happen at least within 24 hours.

Ethyl Chloride: Due to his spider-like physiology, Spider-man is susceptible to this chemical pesticide. Spraying him directly will deal 1d8 damage and half, rounded down, his Acrobatics skill for a turn. Any incoming attack with a weapon imbued in it will have an extra d6 of damage.

Web Shooter Capacity: Every time spider-man uses one of his web attacks, he uses some of his web fluid. He usually carries with 10 clips of web fluid. Each power that uses webs consumes a certain quantity of a web fluid clip. Blue powers consume 10% of the clip, green powers consume 20% of the clip, yellow powers consume 30% of the clip, red powers consume 40% of the clip and his extreme power consume 50% of the clip. Each time spider-man uses 100% of a clip, he must use an action to change the clip for a new one. When spider-man runs out of all 10 clips, he won’t be able to use his web powers until a long rest, where he produces more web fluid.

name: Iron Man
description: Genius billionaire inventor, industrialist and CEO of Stark Industries Tony Stark was fatally wounded in a war zone in Sin-Cong shortly before being kidnapped by terrorists. Stark built an armored suit to escape captivity, which doubled as a device to keep his heart beating keeping him alive. Once he returned to the United States, Stark reinvented himself as the armor-clad superhero Iron Man. In times when Tony Stark was indisposed, other men have carried on the legacy of Iron Man. Twice did Tony's best friend Jim Rhodes, and the duty has fallen into the hands of the reformed villain Victor von Doom. Most recently, the role has been usurped by Tony's adopted brother, Arno Stark.
abilities: Master Engineer: He is an excellent engineer and mechanic capable of fixing almost any, if not all machinery.
Master Businessman: Stark is extremely well-respected in the business world, so he has proficiency throws on bargains and negotiations
Skilled Marksman: Tony has proficiency on firearms, mainly on the ones he has produced.
Multilingual: Apart from English, Tony can speak different languages fluently, including Japanese, Mandarin Chinese, French, Russian, and Korean. He also might know multiple Middle Eastern languages.
Night Mechanic: Iron Man can take time from his long rest to repair one of his armors, if he needs to heal, he will heal his entire HP but 10.
weaknesses: Alcoholism: Tony has quit drinking, but if he gets to drink alcohol again, he is vulnerable to come back to his addiction. When drinking any kind of alcoholic beverage Tony must make a wisdom save of 16 to resist his addiction. If failed, he turns back into an alcoholic. If Tony turns an alcoholic again, he must drink any kind of alcoholic beverage until he gets drunk every night or will have abstinence syndrome, which will make him unable to have any kind of rest, and his wisdom and perception will be reduced to 1. When alcoholic, Tony can attempt to leave behind his addiction once a day, by throwing a wisdom save of 15.

name: Captain America
description: Cpt. Steven Rogers a.k.a. Captain America, the First Avenger, was rejected by the U.S. Army during World War II due to numerous health problems. He ultimately volunteered for Project Rebirth where he received the Super-Soldier Serum developed by Dr. Abraham Erskine. The serum greatly enhanced his frail body to the peak of human physicality. As the Sentinel of Liberty, alongside his best friend Bucky Barnes and the Invaders, Rogers and others helped the allies win the war, but not before he was lost at sea and frozen in ice in a form of suspended animation for decades. He was thawed out in the modern age to continue the battle alongside his new allies the Avengers. Cap is loyal to no politician or government and instead upholds the timeless principles of freedom, equality and justice of the American Dream.
abilities: Hand Magnet: Captain America possesses a powerful, ultra-lightweight, Proto-Adamantium oriented magnet in the back of his hand, allowing him to recover his shield from distances up to 60 ft.
Enhanced Metabolism: Captain America has a great metabolism which allows him to heal after 2 turns from poisoned, burned, irradiated and stunned status effects. He can’t get drunk.

Enhanced Senses: Due to the Super Soldier Serum, Captain America’s senses heightened to peak human level. This means he can’t be surprised, and he doesn't have disadvantage when checking perception against invisible characters.

Lesser Healing Factor: Captain America can heal faster than an average human, thanks to the Super Soldier Serum. This allows him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.

Indomitable Will: As a result of a strong willpower, Captain America has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He also gets a +5 bonus in any check when being charmed or telepathically controlled. He is immune to purple control.
Master Martial Artist: As a master of various martial arts, Captain America has proficiency in Melee.

Worthy: Captain America’s pure heart allows him to hold Mjolnir and use all its powers with all dices turned into their half equivalent. Additionally, Hammer Throw only affects one opponent and doesn’t return to his hand.
Multilingual: Captain America is fluent in English, Spanish, Japanese, German and Russian, and has basic knowledge of French and Italian.

name: Thor
description: Thor is the God of Thunder, a member of the race known as the Asgardians, a group of humanoid beings from the pocket dimension of Asgard, the Realm Eternal.Thor is the son of Odin, the All-Father and King of Asgard. He was worshiped by the humans known as Vikings and became part of Norse Mythology. Armed with his enchanted Uru hammer Mjolnir, which helps him to channel his godly energies, he became the mightiest warrior in the Ten Realms. When his irresponsible and impetuous behavior became too much, Odin sent him to Midgard (more commonly known as Earth) stripped of his memory. After learning humility, he regained his memory as well as his godly powers. Thor went on to become a champion for Midgard as well as one of the founding members of the Avengers, Earth's Mightiest Heroes
abilities: Invulnerability: As a result of his Asgardian physique, Thor afforded immunity to get burned, poisoned, irradiated and any kind of human disease. He is also immune to electric and poison damage.

Indomitable Will: As a result of a strong willpower, Thor has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He is immune to being purple controlled,
Asgardian Sense: Thor has powerful senses that allow him to see objects that are moving at high speed. He can’t be attacked by surprise or by a sneak attack.

Lesser Healing Factor: Thor can heal faster than an average human, thanks to his blessed Asgardian body, allowing him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Flight: As a bonus action Thor can fly anywhere in a 60 ft. cube in one turn.
Worthy: Thor's pure heart allows him to hold Mjolnir.
All-Tongue: Thor speaks in All-Tongue, meaning everyone can understand as if they were hearing in their own language.
weaknesses: Merit for being Worthy: Thor's pure heart allows him to wield his Mjolnir and the many of his powers that come with it. If he commits any action that inhibits him from being considered “worthy”, he will become Unworthy. When Unworthy, Thor can't use any of his powers, which means he can only attack with normal attacks that will get reduced to 1d8. He also loses all his abilities. To become worthy again, he must commit a heroic action that convince the GM he is worthy again.
Berserker's Rage: When Thor gets berserkers rage during battle, meaning he will attack randomly any ally or foe on the battlefield. He will maintain this status until he kills somebody.

Warrior's Madness: Thor's mind is tormented by the many instances of his powers that were removed from him when Odin sent him to Midgard. Because of this, he developed the Warrior's Madness. Every time he uses one of his powers, he gains a Madness point. When he earns 5 Madness Points, he must save to 14 Wisdom, or he will have an illusion that will distract him in battle and will make him lose one turn. When he earns 10 Madness Points, he will have strong headaches that will deal 1d8 damage every turn on battle. When he earns 15 madness points, he will go on a Berserker’s Rage. However, once every long rest, he can meditate in his free time to reduce 1 of his Madness points. He can also meditate during battle, which will take an entire turn but allows him to reduce 1 Madness point. He can also escape to find himself for an entire day, which will make him escape from his team on a journey to keep his sanity until a long rest and will make him lose all his Madness points.

name: Hulk
description: Dr. Bruce Banner, Ph.D. a.k.a. the Hulk is an American theoretical physicist, famed for his work into the studies of nuclear physics and gamma radiation. He was recruited by General Thaddeus Ross and the US Army to develop the first Gamma Bomb. During its first live test he was bombarded with a massive dose of gamma rays while saving Rick Jones, a kid who was out on the test site. He was mutated into a green behemoth, the living personification of rage, fueled by pure physical strength and would come to be known as the near mindless Incredible Hulk. Fearful of the damage that Hulk could inflict, as well as fleeing from the military, he went on the run. He later found a home among the Avengers, Earth's Mightiest Heroes, for a short time.
abilities: Foreign Chemical Resistant: Hulk is resistant to radioactive or poison damage attacks, and he is immune to being poisoned or irradiated.

Regenerative Healing Factor: Hulk has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. His dice increases into 1d6 at level 5, then 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 15 and 1d12 at level 20. Additionally, he can regenerate body parts after losing them. If he is in possession of his lost limb, he can re-attach it and fixing time will be 1d10 minutes or, if in battle, 1d4 turns. If the limb is lost, he must wait an amount of 2d12 hours for it to fully grow again and, in the case of a hand or arm, a third of that time to partially grow and being able only to hold small objects. If he gets decapitated, he can stay alive if he succeeds on a Durability check of 25 and someone else must help him to reattach his head to his body. If in battle, the one helping him will spend an entire turn just helping him. If his head is lost, he can regrow it if he succeeds a Durability save of 27 and it will take him 3d12 hours to fully recover. If fallen, he just needs two successes to wake up.
Not now: If Hulk receives a Final Strike, he will need to pass a Durability check of 20 to remain in Hulk mode and remain stable. If failed, he reverts to Bruce Banner and dies.

Rage: If hulk stays in his Hulk form for three turns in battle, he will activate his rage. Rage will increase his strength in 1 and will activate all his rage powers. To stop his rage, hulk must save 10 intelligence. If failed, he will start rampage.
Hulk Jump: As a bonus action, the Hulk can jump 60 ft horizontally in battle.
Disease Immunity: Hulk’s irradiated cells make him completely immune to any disease on Earth.
Underwater Breathing: Hulk developed a special gland that allows him to breath underwater.
Telepathic Resistance: Since Hulk’s mind is divided into two personalities, telepathic attacks are not effective against him. He cannot be Telepathically controlled or Purple Controlled.
Astral Perception: Hulk can see and interact with any being that belongs to the astral plane such as ghosts.
Stunning Combo:  If Hulk deals a full successful combo on a character, he leaves his victim stunned.
weaknesses: HULK ANGRY!!: Before reverting into Bruce Banner, Hulk needs to calm down first. Problem is Hulk is always so angry that he needs a lot of focus to relax. Because of this, he needs to pass an Intelligence check of 10 to achieve it. If failed, Hulk starts rampage. On level 10, this check is reduced to 9. On level 20 its reduced to 8.
Big Guy: Due to having a big size, Hulk cannot manipulate human-designed firearms or 1H melee weapons.

Rampage: For every turn Hulk is in battle; he gets a 10% chance of starting rampage. However, for each turn he is on rage, his chances of getting rampage increase 10%. When rage ends, the chances of rampage are 10% again. When in rampage, the Hulk will attack the nearest character, ally, or enemy. To stop the rampage, Hulk must make an intelligence check of 10. Each turn he fails; this check increases in 1.
Hard Climbing: When Hulk climbs a wall, he breaks that surface. Partially or fully is determined by the GM.

name: Hawkeye
description: Clint Barton a.k.a. Hawkeye is an American skilled marksman, archer, and former circus performer and minor super villain turned member of the Avengers, Earth's Mightiest Heroes. As a member of the Avengers, he always had friction with the team, but always returned to fight any threat. Barton was raised in the circus, trained by criminals, and grew from a troubled youth into one of Earth's greatest heroes. Known for his use of a bow and arrow as his primary weapon, his skill is so great that it appears like he never misses. He has worked with Black Widow, whom he developed a strong friendship with. For many years, he was married to fellow super hero Mockingbird, and together they were the original founders of the West Coast Avengers.
abilities: Arrows: Hawkeye uses arrows for all his powers. He always carries several (Level + 5) arrows. Every short rest he recharges his number of arrows. During battle he can use one turn to pick up half of his total arrows.

Arrow String: Hawkeye can carry 3 strings that he can attach, as a bonus action to 3 of his arrows. This will help him to get back these arrows once he threw them. If he throws again a recovered power arrow it will spend a power point. However, once a recovered arrow is thrown again it can’t be recovered any more. He gets an extra string at levels 5, 10 and 15.
Powerless: All off Hawkeyes powers except for the normal arrow spend only 1 power point. The power level only indicates on which level is the power unlocked.
Master Martial Artist: As a master of various martial arts, Hawkeye has proficiency in Melee.

Peak Human Sight: Barton possesses extraordinary eyesight. His eyes are more acute than normal humans. His flawless sight allows him to perfectly aim his targets without even looking. Thus, he can still aim even if blinded and he has the double sight range.
Talented Weapons Designer: He has proficiency when crafting any kind of tools or weapons
Multilingual: Not only is Hawkeye fluent in English, his mother tongue, but also in Italian and in American sign language.
Extra throw: After throwing a normal arrow, Hawkeye can throw again. He gains more extra throws at levels 7 and 14 and 20.
Expert Vehicular operator: Clint has proficiency on vehicle driving and repairing.

name: Black Widow
description: Natalia Alianovna Romanova (English: Natasha Romanoff; Russian: Наталья Наташа Романоф Алиьяновна Романова) a.k.a. Black Widow (Russian: Черная вдова) was a former Russian KGB agent. She was trained by the Red Room as part of the Black Widow Ops Program to be the ultimate Super-Spy. She defected to the United States of America from the Soviet Union to join S.H.I.E.L.D. Later Black Widow would then become a member of the Avengers and has been on the team on multiple occasions. She is a woman with a mysterious past which few know about.
abilities: Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Black widow in a 15 ft. distance, she can use an opportunity attack immediately, even out of her turn.
Martial Arts Master: Being a master in martial arts, Black Widow has proficiency in Melee.
Disguises Expert: Natasha is an expert with disguises. Every long rest, when desired, she can design and craft any kind of costume.
Pistols: Natasha has 2 Baretta M9 as her basic equipment
Multilingual: Natasha is fluent in Russian, English, French, German, Chinese, Japanese, and Italian.
Learned Intelligence Natasha is a quick learner, she can use three long rests to easily learn from others any kind of skill which will get her +3 on any skill she doesn’t know.
Graceful Dancer: Natasha is a profound ballet dancer.
Master Seductress: She is an expert in the field of seduction. She can attempt to seduce male characters and charm them, However, they can avoid this charm by passing a wisdom check of 10.

name: Ant-Man
description: Scott Lang was born and raised in Coral Gables, Florida, the son of Bob Lang. He later became an electronic engineer and met and married Peggy Rae. Together they had a daughter Cassandra Lang but later divorced. When his daughter Cassie was diagnosed as having a serious congenital heart condition, Lang sought the aid of surgeon Dr. Erica Sondheim. Desperate to help his daughter, Lang decided to return to thievery. Breaking into the New Jersey home of Dr. Henry Pym, Lang stole Ant-Man's Suit. Unknown to him, Pym observed the theft and in his guise as Yellowjacket, followed Lang, curious to see what use he would put the paraphernalia. Garbed as Ant-Man, Lang broke into Cross and discovered Dr. Sondheim was held prisoner by Darren Cross, president of CTE, who needed Sondheim to correct his own heart condition. Rescuing Sondheim and defeating Cross, Lang was relieved when Sondheim was able to save the life of his daughter. Lang intended to return the Ant-Man costume to its owner and turn himself in, but Henry Pym offered to let him keep them, provided Lang put them to lawful use.
abilities: Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Ant-Man in a 15 ft. distance he can use an opportunity attack immediately, even out of his turn.
Electrical Engineer: Ant-Man has a master’s in electrical engineering, which allows him to study and break through many energy systems in buildings.
Insect Communication and Control: Using his retractable antennae, Ant-man could communicate with and control certain higher insects.
Master Thief: Scott is a skilled thief, so he has proficiency throws when attempting to steal objects from others.

name: Wasp
description: Janet Van Dyne is a fashion designer and socialite who also acts as the winsome super-heroine known as the Wasp. In order to avenge the death of her father at the hands of an extradimensional creature, she was exposed to the size-altering Pym Particles and was biologically altered by Dr. Hank Pym, the tiny adventurer Ant-Man. As the Wasp, she became Pym's crime-fighting partner, having the ability to shrink in size, fly with synthetic wings and fire energy stings. Alongside Pym, she became a founding member of the Avengers, being personally responsible for suggesting the name of the group.
abilities: Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Wasp in a 15 ft. distance, she can use an opportunity attack immediately, even out of her turn.

Talented Fashion Designer: Janet is a very talented fashion designer. During her early days as the Wasp, she would constantly make new costumes for herself and wear different ones for almost every new mission. She can take a long rest to design costumes or disguises for her partners.
Insect Communication and control: Using her retractable antennae, the wolver could communicate with and control certain higher insects.
Multilingual: Janet could speak fluent English, Spanish, Hungarian, French, and Italian. She has also taught herself to speak the language of the Microverse.

name: Black Panther
description: T'Challa a.k.a. the Black Panther is the head of state of the African nation of Wakanda, the most technologically advanced country on Earth. In this role, he was the King/Chieftain, religious leader, and commander-in-chief all rolled into one. He is also considered among the top intellects in the world. Using Wakanda's advanced Vibranium technology and his own abilities and fortune, he pledged his life to the service of all humankind. He would go on to become a prominent member of the Avengers, and eventually become leader of the team.
abilities: Kinetic Charge: Black Panther’s habit absorbs Kinetic energy. When Black Panther gets hit, he absorbs 1 point of kinetic energy. When he gets hit 10 times, he will automatically release all this energy, dealing 1d8 damage to every character in a 30 ft ratio.
Superhuman Vision: T’Challa can see in the dark and detect ultraviolet and infrared spectrum.

Expert Tracker & Hunter: Even without his superhuman senses, T'Challa is an expert tracker and hunter. He can pick up a prey's scent and memorize tens of thousands of individual ones. He has proficiency when trying to track or follow enemies. He can detect invisible, hidden, and stealth characters.
Multilingual: T'Challa can fluently speak Wakandan, Yoruba, Hausa, English, German and Turkish.
Master Inventor: He can invent various devices with special properties when needed and according to the GM limits.
Highly Influential Connections: As king of Wakanda, he has proficiency throws on bargains and negotiations.
Diplomatic Immunity: T’Challa is the king of Wakanda. He cannot go to jail.
Musical Skill: T'Challa is a skilled musician and can play the flute.

name: Vision
description: The Vision is a synthezoid, an advanced android, built to replicate the human form using Horton Cells, with the Solar Gem to give him consciousness. He was constructed by Ultron using parts of the original Human Torch which was created by Phineas Horton. He was later modified using brain patterns partially based on those of Wonder Man and then Alex Lipton. He turned on his creator and joined the Avengers, becoming one of its leading members.
abilities: Phasing: Vision can reduce his density to phase through any solid object.

Computer Brain: Vision’s brain functions like a computer, enabling him to interact, wirelessly or directly, with other computer systems to utilize or extract data from them which can be stored in his databanks. This means he throws in advantage whenever he tries to interact with any kind of computer.
Holographic Manipulation: Vision can generate holograms to disguise himself as a human wearing a trench coat or even render himself invisible.
Multilingual: Vision can adapt his language to any on earth
Audio Sensitivity: The Vision can adjust the sensitivity of his audio receptors to a point where he can detect the faintest of sounds. He can detect invisible, hidden, and stealth characters.
Optical Scanners: He can scan life forms, energy sources and even objects detecting the substances that they are composed of and the energies that are radiating from them.
Vocal Manipulation: The Vision can make himself sound like a machine or even a human; indeed, by perfect duplication of human voiceprints, he can make himself sound like any human he chooses.

name: Scarlet Witch
description: Wanda Maximoff, also known as the Scarlet Witch, is a Romani Transian sorceress and twin sister of the speedster Quicksilver. Once believed to have been mutant children of Magneto, the twins are in truth orphans enhanced by the High Evolutionary at Mount Wundagore. The Scarlet Witch became a conduit of chaos magic, allowing her to shift probabilities and warp reality itself in the form of hexes. After being saved from an angry mob by Magneto, the Scarlet Witch and her brother joined the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants to fight for Magneto's mutant supremacy cause. Disagreeing with Magneto's ruthless approach, the twins left him and joined the super-heroic Avengers instead.
abilities: Expert Combatant: Being an expert in hand-to-hand combat, Scarlet Witch has proficiency in Melee.
Aviation Intuition: Wanda is skilled in piloting aircraft.
Occultism & Magical Knowledge: Wanda is one of the most powerful and learned Sorceress on the planet and mortal plane. Thus, she has proficiency on magic.

Meditation: Wanda can enter and achieve oneness with her spiritual essence as well her mind, making her able to develop a high-level consciousness over bodily processes, as well as reduce stress and pain in the body. She is also able to detach herself from worldly concerns, achieve spiritual enlightenment, and gain control of all her abilities, healing confusion, frightening, blinding, deafening, stunning and charming.
Multilingual: Wanda is fluent in several languages include English, French, Serbian, Romani dialects, German, Russian with at least some knowledge of Greek and very little Slorenian.

Expert Tactician & Leadership: Wanda is skilled in the planning and execution of tactics, when sane, with this coming from the experience and leadership skills gained through years of active duty as an Avenger.
weaknesses: Mental Illness: Although she appears to be currently sane, her mental stability is still questionable. Wanda has undergone mental breakdowns, episodes of mental illness, and severe suicidal depression relating to her powers and personal traumas. When in very stressful situations, the master can ask wanda for a Wisdom check. If failed, she will start a fight with one of her allies.

name: Quicksilver
description: Pietro Maximoff is a speedster and the twin brother of Scarlet Witch, Pietro was kidnapped from Serbia and brought to Wundagore Mountain, base of the High Evolutionary. For years, he and his twin sister, Wanda, believed they were the were the children of Romany couple, Django and Marya Maximoff, later revealed to be the twins' maternal uncle and aunt. Magneto pressed them into service in his Brotherhood of Evil Mutants, costumed them, and named them the Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver. However, they left the brotherhood eventually and sought refuge with the Avengers, a world-renowned team of super heroes.
abilities: Expert Combatant: Being an expert in hand-to-hand combat, Pietro has proficiency in Melee.
Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Quicksilver in a 20 ft. distance he can use an opportunity attack immediately, even out of his turn.
Speedster: Pietro always has the first turn in battle. Unless somebody gets a 20 check in initiative.
Multilingual: Pietro is fluent in some languages including English, Romani dialects and Russian.

name: Falcon
description: Sam Wilson grew up in a tough Harlem neighborhood. His father, a minister, had been killed trying to stop a fight. Sam did his best to try and do the right thing, volunteering and becoming a social worker. Sam was lured to a Caribbean island named Exile where the Red Skull and his henchmen were hiding out. After their initial skirmish, Captain America and Sam defeated the Skull, and the Falcon became Cap's partner for a long time. Allegedly, Red Skull used the Cosmic Cube to give Sam the ability to telepathically communicate with birds, especially a bird that Wilson had bought named Redwing. The Falcon ultimately left as Cap's partner when he was named the leader of the S.H.I.E.L.D. Super-Agents. Later, as one of the few black super heroes active, he was drafted to join the Avengers by Henry Peter Gyrich to fill a quota. Resenting being a “token”, he quit at the first opportunity.
abilities: Avian Telepathy: Sam was given the ability to telepathically link with birds endowed by the Red Skull using the Cosmic Cube.
Pistols: Sam has 2 Baretta M9 as his basic equipment.
Expert Combatant: Being an expert in hand-to-hand combat, Falcon has proficiency in Melee.
Leadership: Sam has lead S.H.I.E.L.D. Super-Agents with proficient tactician and strategist.

name: Winter Soldier
description: Bucky Barnes is an American Soldier turned Soviet spy and assassin. He was recruited to the U.S. Army during World War II after being a ward of the state. He fought alongside his best friend, Captain America, the Sentinel of Liberty and the Invaders, and together they helped the Allies win the war. Bucky was believed to be dead near the end of the war, only to have been found and brainwashed by the Soviets led by Vasily Karpov, who made him the Winter Soldier. He was sent on clandestine missions and committed some of the worst assassinations over the next 50 years. His memory was returned to him decades later and he became the new Captain America after Steve Rogers was seemingly murdered and also joined the Avengers. When Steve returned, he took up the identity of the Winter Soldier once again.
abilities: Weapons Master: Bucky is a master of many different weapons.
Multilingual: Barnes is fluent in English, Russian, German, Japanese, Chinese, and a little French.
Expert Tactician: Barnes is a very skilled strategist.

Master Spy: Barnes is an expert in the field of espionage. He is skilled in stealth, demolitions, survival, deducing other persons ways of thinking and other fields. He has advantage on espionage throws.
Lesser Healing Factor: Bucky can heal faster than an average human, thanks to the Infinity Formula, allowing him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Enhanced Metabolism: Bucky has a great metabolism which allows him to heal after 2 turns from poisoned, burned, radioactive and stunned status effects. He can’t get drunk.
Enhanced Senses: Due to the Infinity Formula, Bucky's senses heightened to peak human level. This means he can’t be surprised, and he doesn’t have to check perception against invisible characters.
Weapon equipment: The Winter Soldier has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions, which includes a Colt M1911 .45, 3 Flash Grenade, 1 Incendiary Grenade and a Knife
weaknesses: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder. Due to all his experiences as a soldier for Hydra, Bucky has remorse and stress. The guilt could render him stunned when being confronted by his past.

name: War Machine
description: A skilled military pilot, Jim Rhodes is one of the few people Tony Stark trusts to use the technology of the Iron Man Armor, flying high in his own suit as War Machine. An aviator engineer for Stark Industries, Rhodes was also the personal pilot and eventually confidant of Tony Stark. When Tony was overwhelmed by his relapsing alcoholism, Rhodey donned the Iron Man suit himself. Although he stepped up to the mark, the lack of proper calibrations in the armor affected Rhodey's psyche and he had to step down, paving the way for Tony to return as Iron Man. Later on, after Stark was seemingly assassinated, Rhodey reluctantly heeded Tony's will and became Iron Man again, wearing a new armor made specifically for him. Once he learned that Stark had survived in secret, Rhodey temporarily cut ties with him, and went solo, adopting the alias of War Machine.
abilities: War Machine Armor: In battle, James Rhodes uses his War Machine armor. This armor can be damaged, or even destroyed during battle. Rhodes doesn’t have the mechanic and electronic knowledge to fix his armor, so whenever it gets destroyed, he must send it to Tony’s lab for it to be repaired. It will take 1 in-game day for it to be repaired.
Skilled Engineer: Rhodes served several tours in Southeast Asia, studying while in the service to become an aviation engineer.
Skilled Aviator: He is a skilled helicopter pilot and is capable of maneuvering most if not all Stark-designed armors. He has advantage on piloting throws.
Skilled Marksman: Aside from his armor's weaponry, he is a very good marksman.
Skilled Combatant: Rhodes military training made him a very skilled hand to hand combat. He also trained in boxing as a young man.
Skilled Survivalist: With intense military training, he can survive in harsh condition and environments.

name: Captain Marvel
description: Carol Danvers is a Human/Kree hybrid and a military warrior, better known as the high-flying super hero Captain Marvel. With no support from her authoritarian father, a young Danvers took to the sky in the Air Force by herself as a promising cadet, quickly escalating to rank of Major as an intelligence agent. Eventually, she was tasked to be a head of security at NASA, when it was infiltrated by a Kree soldier named Captain Mar-Vell. Accidentally subjected to the Psyche-Magnitron machine, Danvers was imprinted with energy from Mar-Vell's Kree Nega-Bands, which triggered the manifestation of her mighty abilities. Initially adopting the name Ms. Marvel, she established herself as a vigilante and joined the Avengers. Her life was extirpated from her control after she was manipulated by the villain Marcus. Targeted by the mutant terrorist Rogue, she was stolen of her powers, memories and personality. In a very lengthy process, Danvers recovered her abilities, and forged a prominent super hero career on Earth and in outer space, having the X-Men, the Starjammers, the Avengers, and the Guardians of the Galaxy, as her allies. Ultimately, Danvers has gone on to adopt the mantle of Captain Marvel for herself.
abilities: Flash Precognition: Carol can anticipate the moves of her opponents, though this power activated randomly, making it unreliable. This makes her have a 50% chance to avoid any kind of sneak attack.
Multilingual: Carol is fluent in English, Russian, and Arabic, as well as Kree, and both common and Imperial Shi'ar. She speaks passable Rajaki and very little Chinese.
Experienced Spy: Carol is an experienced spy, having worked various undercover operations for Air Force Intelligence.
Lesser Healing Factor: Carol can heal faster than an average human, allowing her to heal 1d4 every turn. Her dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.

Contaminant Immunity: Carol's regenerative powers coupled with her human/alien Kree physiology are so potent that she has a greater degree of immunity to toxins, diseases and/or poisons. She is immune to being irradiated, poisoned, drunk or drugged.
Space Flight: Carol can survive unaided in the vacuum of space for indefinite periods of time.
Energy Strike: If Captain Marvel deals a full successful combo against another character, she will leave her victim irradiated.

name: Doctor Strange
description: Dr. Stephen Strange, M.D., a.k.a. Doctor Strange, was the Sorcerer Supreme for Earth. Strange was once a brilliant but arrogant neurosurgeon, until a car accident crippled his hands. When modern medicine failed him, he embarked on a journey to Kamar-Taj in Tibet, where he was trained by the Ancient One. He healed his hands and learned more about Magic, eventually becoming a Master of the Mystic Arts. He settled in the Sanctum Sanctorum in Greenwich Village, New York City, becoming the Earth's protector from any mystical threats.
abilities: Telepathy: Dr. Strange can psychically communicate with other characters on a 90 ft radius, he can also read minds to know what a character is thinking, it is an action in combat.

Universal Awareness: By performing mediation Dr. Strange has sensed anomalies in time and space allowing him to protect against time travelers, extra-dimensional invaders (Example: Dormammu, Nightmare), space aliens, etc. By staying highly concentrated by 10 in-game minutes, Dr. Strange can detect any major threat that is coming.

Expert Strategist: Though Stephen seems to suffer from an impulsive nature, instinctively jumping into situations of life-or-death, it's apparent that he works best this way possessing considerable strategic skills, which has been employed in leadership structures, and spontaneous situations, all of which is a necessity in the random environment of Mysticism.

Sorcerer: As a powerful Sorcerer, Dr. Strange learns many magic spells as his basic powerset. However, at levels 5, 10, 15 and 20, he can learn one more power from any of the magic and arcana books like the book of the vishanti or the book of cagliostro. He can attempt learning any spell from these books if meeting the requirements.

Former Expert Surgeon/Surgical Consultant: Strange holds an M.D. in neurosurgery and was once considered one of the foremost experts in his field. However, the nerve damage he suffered in his car crash severely compromised the manual dexterity in his hands, preventing him from performing surgery except when temporarily supplemented by magic. Even without magic, Strange retains his medical knowledge. He has shown himself capable of providing reasonable guidance to other less skilled, yet un-maimed surgeons through intense effort and is still capable of serving as a consultant.

Skilled Martial Artist: Dr. Strange is a skilled athlete and was trained in the martial arts used by Tibetan monks in Kamar Taj, proving sufficiently talented to pass down such training to others, such as Clea. These talents have assisted him from time-to-time when incapable of using his sorcery. Strange is a formidable opponent to any skilled attacker and continues to train regularly with Wong. He has in some cases, been known to occasionally spar with other heroes; in one case, Strange was able to evade a kung fu hand-chop by Mantis (the future mother of the Quoi), only three others have ever done, and who has been able to subdue Thor in sheer physical combat, despite his strength nearly hundreds of times superior to her own.
weaknesses: Incantations and Gestures Dependency: Strange also depends on spoken incantations, mystical gesturing, and his arcane artifacts in his duties; likely these can be counted as weaknesses. Strange has been incapacitated various times by being gagged and bound, preventing him from uttering arcane invocations or performing mystic gestures.

Magic-Induced Physical Changes: A fact not known by many people is that the use of magic takes a physical toll on its user. During his first lessons, Stephen vomited for three days straight because of this. As years went by, Strange's body changed so much his stomach can't even accept human food and can only ingest the still-squirming meal.

name: Ghost Rider
description: Johnny Blaze a.k.a Ghost Rider is an American motorcycle stunt performer, and entertainer turned Spirit of Vengeance. He was the son of famed stuntman Barton Blaze who tragically died during a stunt. He became bound to Zarathos the Spirit of Vengeance after making a deal with the Demon Mephisto to spare the life of his surrogate father Crash Simpson. Now with the power to control Hellfire and to inflict pain on those he deemed evil with his Penance Stare, Blaze seeks vengeance riding his Hell Cycle as the Ghost Rider.
abilities: Sin Removal: When learning of a Sin of a mortal character, Johnny can try to change their mind by removing said Sin. The other character must save to 19 Wisdom to be able to overcome its Sin. This doesn’t work on bosses.
Dimensional Travel: Ghost Rider can traverse different dimensions once every long rest.
Occult Knowledge: Ghost Rider possesses knowledge of the occult and supernatural.

Soul Reading: Ghost Rider can feel the transgression of an individual he encounters by looking into their heart and soul. He can also decide whether a person is innocent or evil and in need of punishment. He can do this ability without the process of transformation. In battle, he can use this as a bonus action.

Hell Cycle: As a bonus action, Ghost Rider can call his hell cycle. If he is in battle and he is 20ft close to an enemy, he must save to 16 Bike Piloting to be able to get on his motorcycle and do another action. If failed, he will get in his motorcycle, but he won’t be able to do another action.
weaknesses: Corruption: A very dangerous side effect of using the Damnation Stare is that their moral bankruptcy contaminates the Rider bit by bit, making Blaze susceptible to Mephisto's direct control the more he uses it. Every time he uses this power, he must save to 15 Wisdom, or he will be charmed by Mephisto.
Heavenly Weapons: Any kind of holly attacks deal double damage to ghost rider.

Host Separation: The Spirit of Vengeance, Zarathos, itself never truly dies. However, the Spirit can’t physically manifest without a host to be bounded with. If the Spirit is forcefully separated from the host, the latter would return to be mortal, while the Spirit will remain in its current state until it finds a new body to inhabit.

name: Daredevil
description: The son of boxer Battlin' Jack, Matt Murdock grew up in the relative poverty of Hell's Kitchen with much reverence for his father.As a boy, shortly before the death of his father, Matt witnessed a man about to be hit by a truck and pushed him out of the way but the truck crashed and spilled its cargo of extremely toxic chemicals into his face. He awoke in the hospital blind from the toxins and learned that his other senses were amplified as a result of his loss of sight and was able to see by a radar-like sense using natural sounds around him, giving him ultimate confidence in his surroundings. As an adult, he became a lawyer and opened a law firm with Foggy Nelson while secretly taking on the mantle of Daredevil in order to protect the citizens of Hell's Kitchen and bring justice to the streets as well as the courtroom. His arch nemesis is Kingpin and other side villains include Electro, the psychotic Bullseye, and Daredevil's frequent love interest Elektra. Over time he has frequently sparred with other heroes, such as Spider-Man and the Punisher. He carries a multi-purpose cane, disguised as a blind man's cane in his day life. It has a range of different modes including Nunchaku and Bo-Staff.
abilities: Blindsight: Daredevil is not affected by any kind of darkness. He is also immune to the blind status effect.

Radar Sense: Daredevil can’t be attacked by surprise. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. When being attacked from behind, the attacker never has advantage.

Living Radar: Daredevil can notice the presence of any living creature in a 120 ft. radius. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. This radar still works even if Radar Sense is disabled.
Eavesdropper: Daredevil can hear any sound in a 200 ft. radio, giving him advantage in Espionage when listening to conversations. However, he must concentrate to be able to hear clearly.
Human Bloodhound: Daredevil can smell anything in a radio of 80 ft., giving him advantage in Tracking when looking for specific people or certain specific objects.
Lie Detector: You can’t lie to Daredevil. He can detect when a person is lying.

Indomitable Will: As a result of a strong willpower, Daredevil has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He also gets a +5 bonus in any check when being charmed or telepathically controlled. He is immune to purple control.
Master Attorney: When using deception or persuasion, Daredevil can use an extra d4 to convince other characters.
The Man Without Fear: Daredevil is immune to fear attacks or spells and can’t get “frightened” status effect.
Illusion Awareness: Being blind and having superhuman senses, Daredevil is aware at all times of the true reality around him, giving him advantage when saving against an illusion.
Devout Catholic: Daredevil throws in advantage when verbally discussing about religion.
weaknesses: Blindness: Daredevil is blind. This means he can’t discern flat pictures, pages or screens and he is completely senseless when his radar sense is disrupted. This also means any visual enhancer is rendered useless.

Sound Disruption: Daredevil is vulnerable to any kind of sound damage. When deafened, his defense lowers to 13, his melee lowers to 0 and attack rolls against him are thrown on advantage and all attack throws made by him are thrown in disadvantage.
Pacemakers: Daredevil has a hard time detecting lies from people with a pacemaker. If a target has one, he/she can attempt to lie to Daredevil.

Smell Disruption: Daredevil’s superhuman smell sense makes him distractible to strong bad smells. While affected, his smell radio drops to 0 ft. and must save to 12 Durability before every roll. If failed, that roll must be made in disadvantage.

Water Immersion: When underwater, Daredevil’s Radar Sense is rendered useless. Also, he must roll a d12 to know where a sound comes from, having to save to 4 if the sound is strong, to 8 if the sound is intermediate, and to 12 if the sound is small.

name: Jessica Jones
description: On the way home Jessica argued with her brother, before the car collided with a military convoy carrying radioactive chemicals. Her family was killed, and she was exposed to the chemicals. After spending several months in a coma, Jessica recovered and discovered that she had developed superhuman powers such as strength and durability. She attempted to become a super heroine, calling herself Jewel, and was active for about four years. But was later kidnapped by the Purple Man, who kept her prisoner for eight months and used her as an accomplice in his schemes. One day, while battling the Scarlet Witch, she snapped out of Killgrave's control. Thinking the gathered Avengers and Defenders would attack her, Jessica ran away, but was found and nearly killed by the Vision and Iron Man. Jean Grey and the X-men helped Jessica and made her immune to Purple Man's control. After this, she met Luke Cage, fell in love with him and they married. They have a daughter called Danielle. She is no longer a hero, but will help her allies, The Defenders, whenver they need her.
abilities: Telepathic Resistance: Due to her experiences with the Purple Man, Jessica had mental blocks placed in her mind. This occurred after her experiences with Killgrave. If the GM wants to adapt the Alias storyline, Jessica can have this ability removed.
Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Jessica in a 15 ft. distance, she can use an opportunity attack even out of her turn.

Private Investigator: Jessica is an experienced investigator, she can follow leads, interrogate suspects, and has closed many cases. when investigating or interrogating she gets a 1d4 bonus on her checks.
weaknesses: Alcoholism. Jessica has quit drinking, but if she gets to drink alcohol again, she is vulnerable to come back to her addiction. When drinking any kind of alcoholic beverage Jessica must make a wisdom save of 16 to resist her addiction. If failed, she turns back into an alcoholic. If Jessica turns an alcoholic again, she must drink any kind of alcoholic beverage until she gets drunk every night or will have abstinence syndrome, which will make her unable to have any kind of rest, and her wisdom and perception will be reduced to 1. When alcoholic, Jessica can attempt to leave behind her addiction once a day, by throwing a wisdom save of 15.

name: Luke Cage
alterego: Luke Cage (Legally changed from Carl Lucas)
description: Carl Lucas. Power Man. Hero for hire. Luke Cage doesn’t bother with a fancy costume. He doesn’t wear a cape. He doesn’t hide behind a mask. He’s a simple guy with a simple goal: protect the innocent by keeping the streets of New York free of crime. And his bulletproof skin makes easy work of that. Born and raised in Harlem as Carl Lucas, Cage wasn’t always the hero that he would become later in life. Despite his misdeeds and connections to crime, instead of expressing his shock or anger with language strictly forbidden by his grandma, he took to phrases like “Sweet Christmas!” which would eventually become his trademark slogan. He is the hero of Harlem, husband to Jessica Jones, best friend of Iron Fist and member of the Defeners alongside Daredevil.
abilities: Skilled Athlete: He is also a gifted athlete, even without his superhuman abilities.
Extended Education: Cage is self-educated in the law and fluent in several languages, including English and Spanish.
Bulletproof: Luke Cage is immune to damage from low caliber bullets.

Strong Speaker: He has proven to be very good at speaking positively, truthfully, and with charisma in front of large audiences. His innate nobility has earned him the respect and friendship from a good number of different persons.
Lesser Healing Factor: Luke Cage can heal faster than an average human, allowing him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
weaknesses: Near-Unbreakable Flesh: Since Cage's skin cannot be lacerated by conventional materials, his superhuman durability is a hindrance if he suffers injuries that are too severe for him to heal on his own and require surgery, such as internal injuries. While his skin can be lacerated by a highly powerful medical laser and weapons composed of Adamantium, neither of these would be readily available nor easily accessible.
Radiation: Enough exposure to massive amounts of radiation and the resulting burns can kill Cage. Luke receives double damage from radiation-based attacks.

name: Iron Fist
description: Fueled by a desire for revenge, nine-year-old Danny Rand spent a decade training in martial arts in the heavenly city of K'un-Lun. Danny Rand possesses the power to harness the mystical spiritual energy, or chi, as a result of having defeated Shou-Lao the Undying in combat. After he plunged his fists into the dragon's molten heart, absorbing its chi, Rand gained the power of the Iron Fist. Instead of staying and embracing immortality at K'un-Lun, he returned to Earth ten years later to avenge his dead parents. He found nothing more than a hollow victory, but joined a surrogate family of heroes and adventurers whom he would defend to the very end. Iron Fist now works as a hero in New York, befriending Luke Cage, and working as Heroes for Hire. Eventually he would also partner up with Daredevil and Jessica Jones, to form a new group of defenders.
abilities: Nervous System Control: Rand has near-complete control over his nervous system. Danny can pass lie detectors like Daredevil.
Multilingual: He can speak fluent in K'un-Lun, English, Chinese, and has a limited vocabulary in Japanese.
Blinded Fighter: Iron Fist doesn’t get disadvantage when attacking while blinded.

Master Martial Artist: Rand is a master of K’un-lun’s martial arts, and is proficient in many of Earth's martial arts, including but not limited to: Kunlun Quan, Shaolin Quan, Fujian White Crane, Judo, Aikido, Wing Chun, Ninjutsu, Muay Thai, Karate, Boxing, and even loose street fighting tactics. Recently, he has gained access to the knowledge, experience, and skills of all the Iron Fists before him.

name: Punisher
description: Lt. Francis “Frank“ Castle (born Francis Castiglione) a.k.a. the Punisher was an Italian-American former US Marine who served in multiple tours of duty, including the Siancong War, where he received the Bronze Star, Silver Star, and four Purple Hearts. He became a vigilante after seeing his wife; Maria and children; Lisa and Frank Jr. gunned down for accidentally observing a Mafia “hit“. Now with a distinct death's head skull adorning his chest, he devoted his life to the task of destroying organized crime wherever he found it. Nick Fury's intel classified him as being power level 6 or greater due to his fighting skills, his weaponry, and his use of lethal force.
abilities: Master Martial Artist: Castle is a thoroughly seasoned veteran in multiple forms of armed and unarmed combat. Specifically, he is highly adept in American-style CQC (close-quarters combat), ninjutsu, Shorin-ryu Karate, Hwa Rang Do, Chin Na and Nash Ryu Jujutsu, his style of choice being the latter.
Expert Pilot: Castle received helicopter training with the U.S. Army and U.S. Naval Special Warfare Command. He has been shown flying both helicopters and airplanes.

Interrogation Master: Castle uses his skills at interrogation to get information from people through creative use of torture as well such as water boarding, electrocution, suffocation, sleep deprivation, starvation etc. He has advantage when interrogating.

Master Tactician: Armed solely with conventional weapons and motivated by a fanatical hatred for criminals like those who murdered his family, the Punisher has single-handedly incapacitated up to a dozen well-armed and experienced opponents in a single encounter and escaped uninjured. It is his military training and his attention to detail that allows him to achieve this.

Indomitable Will: Frank has complete control of his mind and consciousness, providing a strong resistance against telepathic powers that are used against him. Frank has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He also gets a +5 bonus in any check when being telepathically controlled and he is immune to being charmed. He is immune to purple control.
Bilingual: As well as English, Frank can speak Spanish.

Weapon equipment: The punisher has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. This includes a Baretta M9, 2 Sensor mines, 3 Flash Grenades, 4 Fragmentation Grenades, 2 Incendiary Grenades, an AK 47, a Barrett m82, a Heckler & Koch MP5, a Mossberg 500,a Knife and Portable Turret, which he suses for his Ultimate power. However, he must have in mind his equipment capacity before packing.

name: Elektra
description: Daughter of a slain ambassador with a troubled childhood, Elektra trained to become a supreme martial artist and assassin. An assassin and bounty hunter trained by the ancient ninja cult known as the Hand, Elektra Natchios has a history of getting her jobs done—even when her allies get in the way. Elektra is a master in multiple forms of martial arts, including Ninjutsu, which are heightened by her incredible gymnastic abilities. She matches her physical prowess with a signature pair of sai, which she wields with deadly skill. She has a recurring romance with Daredevil, who she also considers a trusty ally. The assassin has also demonstrated the ability to mesmerize her enemies, causing them see illusions or other phenomena. She can also communicate without words or gestures with those who possess similar levels of mental discipline, like Daredevil.
abilities: Weapons Master: She is a master of many different weapons.
Sai and Shuriken: Elektra has two Sai and 10 shuriken in her basic equipment .
Nervous System Control: Elektra has control over her nervous system. She can pass lie detectors like daredevil.
Precognition: She can have some precognitive visions and see glimpses of future events. The GM can use this power to reveal her any kind of information whenever they desire it.
Multilingual: She can speak fluently English, Greek and Spanish.

name: Mister Fantastic
description: Dr. Reed Richards is a scientist and inventor, better known as Mister Fantastic, who has been considered the smartest man on Earth. He is a polymath with mastery of all the sciences including, electrical, mechanical, aerospace engineering, electronics, chemistry, physics, biology and beyond. Richards was exposed to high levels of cosmic radiation along with his best friend Ben Grimm, then girlfriend Sue Storm and her younger brother Johnny Storm, during a trip to space in the stolen rocket, the Marvel-1. The radiation mutated him and his friends, allowing him to stretch and mold his body at will. Together they became the Fantastic Four, a team of adventurers who explored space, time and alternate dimensions and saved the world along the way from science-based threats. Mister Fantastic possesses the ability to convert the mass of his entire body into a highly malleable state at will.
abilities: Hypnotism: Mister Fantastic is trained in hypnosis. He can attempt to hypnotize non-mentally resistant characters. This requires a throw of wisdom higher of the victim’s throw + wisdom.
Glide: Reed can glide to slowly land from high places, which makes him immune to fall damage, unless he falls while asleep or unconscious.

Contain Explosions: Mister Fantastic may use his elastic form to contain explosions by enveloping them and allowing their force to expand him. He can enclose and absorb the energy of a large explosive, on the order of 8 to 12 pounds of TNT (excluding exotic, high density explosives). Such shocks to his system are physically exhaustin, leaving him stunned for 3 turns.
Universal Translator: Reed has a Universal Translator that can decipher and interpret languages, both alien and terrestrial, into the native language of the user.
weaknesses: Fantastic Four Power Synergism: The original members of the Fantastic Four are tethered to each other, and act as their own conduits of power. They can be apart within their own universe and retain a connection, but prolonged periods cut off from each other in other universes result in a gradual decline in power levels. If they spend too much time separated this way, they will eventually become powerless.

name: Invisible Woman
description: Dr. Susan “Sue“ Richards (née Storm), a.k.a. the Invisible Woman, is an American superpowered adventurer. She was a college student before she was exposed to high levels of cosmic radiation when boyfriend and scientist, Dr. Reed Richards, took her with her younger brother, Johnny Storm and pilot Ben Grimm, into space in the stolen rocket Marvel-1. The radiation mutated her and her friends, turning her invisible and allowing her to create forcefields. Together they became the Fantastic Four, a team of adventurers who explored space, time, and alternate dimensions and saved the world along the way from science-based threats.
abilities: Psionic Floating Platform: Sue can create a psionic platform which she can use to glide at a 40 ft per turn speed.

Color Manipulation: Sue can also apply her ability to manipulate the interactions of light waves to seemingly change the color of objects, for example altering her hair color or turning the Thing pink.

Cosmic Ray Awareness: Sue's retina can detect cosmic rays as well as visible light. This allows her to perceive her own force fields and other invisible objects and, with concentration, can also provide her with a limited form of vision, allowing her to “see“ even if blinded. This makes her immune to the blind condition.
Universal Translator: Sue has a Universal Translator that can decipher and interpret languages, both alien and terrestrial, into the native language of the user.
weaknesses: Fantastic Four Power Synergism: The original members of the Fantastic Four are tethered to each other, and act as their own conduits of power. They can be apart within their own universe and retain a connection, but prolonged periods cut off from each other in other universes result in a gradual decline in power levels. If they spend too much time separated this way, they will eventually become powerless.
Sound Constructs: Invisible Woman's force fields are permeable to sound waves; thus, sound damage can go through force fields.

name: Human Torch
description: Johnny Storm a.k.a. the Human Torch[ is an American superpowered adventurer. He was a high school student before he was exposed to high levels of cosmic radiation when his older sister Sue Storm's boyfriend, scientist Dr. Reed Richards, took them and pilot Ben Grimm into space in the stolen rocket Marvel-1. The radiation mutated the group, transforming Johnny's entire body into a fiery, plasma-like state. Together they became the Fantastic Four, a team of adventurers who explored space, time and alternate dimensions and saved the world along the way from science-based threats.
abilities: Flight: The Human Torch's plasma has a high hydrogen content and is surrounded by an exuded cloud of mono-atomic hydrogen atoms. The hot cloud provides sufficient positive buoyancy for him to float. With mental stimulation of his flame, he can provide enough lift to carry around 180 pounds. By forming a jet from his feet, directed behind him, he can achieve a normal flight speed of 50 ft per turn.

Immunity to Fire & Heat: The Human Torch is unaffected by heat and flames, including his own, even when part of him is aflame and the rest of him is not. His flesh cannot be scalded or burned by any heat source whose level is below that of his maximum output.

Flame on!: As a bonus action, The Human Torch can turn into plasma. In this state, his body is no longer solid, firearms damage is reduced in half and every successful physical attack against him will deal 1d8 fire damage to the attacker. He can also deactivate plasma mode as a bonus action. Plasma mode’s duration depends on Johnny’s health. If he has less than 30% of his health, his flame form will wear off in the next 2 turns, and he will have to wait for 3 turns to be able to turn into plasma again. While in this form, his normal attacks deal fire damage and if he deals a successful combo against another character, he will leave them burned.
weaknesses: Fantastic Four Power Synergism: The original members of the Fantastic Four are tethered to each other, and act as their own conduits of power. They can be apart within their own universe and retain a connection, but prolonged periods cut off from each other in other universes result in a gradual decline in power levels. If they spend too much time separated this way, they will eventually become powerless.
Energy Depletion: At an average rate of expenditure of energy, the Torch can maintain his plasma state for about 16.8 hours before he is forced to revert to his solid state.

Fire Extinguishing: The Human Torch's flame is supported by the presence of oxygen, and thus is extinguished in low air pressure or a vacuum. Thus, he can’t use his plasma mode in outer space. The Torch's flame can be extinguished by smothering materials, such as water, sand, fire-fighting foam, and heat-resistant blankets, unless his flame is at such an intensity that it immediately vaporizes such materials on contact. If a character tries to use any of these materials to extinguish his fire, he can attempt a Thermokinesis throw of 14 to maintain his plasma mode on. If hit with small amounts of water, up to about five gallons, the Torch can turn it to steam with relatively little effort. More water than that could extinguish his flame at its normal level, and he would have to wait until he could evaporate the residual moisture before re-ignition. He can’t turn into the torch underwater.

name: Thing
description: Ben Grimm a.k.a. The Thing was an astronaut and former USAF test pilot. Grimm was exposed to high levels of cosmic radiation when his best friend, scientist Dr. Reed Richards took him and his friends Sue Storm and her younger brother Johnny Storm, into space in the stolen rocket; Marvel-1. The radiation mutated him and his friends, turning him into a super-strong rock like monster with a Heart of Gold. Together they became the Fantastic Four, a team of adventurers who explored space, time, and alternate dimensions and saved the world along the way from science-based threats.
abilities: Superhuman Sensory Adaptation: Though his senses aren't superhumanly acute, his five senses can withstand greater amounts of sensory stimuli than he could when he was a normal human being, with no reduced sensitivity. This was demonstrated during the Fantastic Four's first fight with the Hulk. While the sonic boom caused by Hulk's thunderclap knocked out the rest of the group, Ben was barely phased, only sent slightly back due to the accompanying shockwaves. He cannot get deafened or stunned.

Age Immortality: The Thing cannot age. The only way for him to age is by being in his human form. If he's not turned back to human or decides not to turn back to human one day a year as he's able to, The Thing would theoretically never die.
Experienced Astronaut: Ben has also trained as an astronaut and was piloting Reed Richard's spacecraft during the team's fateful bombardment with cosmic rays.
weaknesses: Fantastic Four Power Synergism: The original members of the Fantastic Four are tethered to each other, and act as their own conduits of power. They can be apart within their own universe and retain a connection, but prolonged periods cut off from each other in other universes result in a gradual decline in power levels. If they spend too much time separated this way, they will eventually become powerless.

Handicap: Ben is limited in his capacity to use normal, everyday appliances due to his sheer size, weight and strength or interact with normal objects. His powers are also implied to have robbed him of his sense of touch. He can’t use digital objects, like phones, keyboards, ATMs, etc. He cannot stand on some platforms like weight scales. He does not fit on medium/small cars.

name: Wolverine
description: Cursed with a berserker fury, the violent mutant known as Wolverine has a reputation of both as an outstanding super hero and as a lethal killer. Born as James Howlett to a wealthy Canadian family at the end of the 19th century, he was forced to abandon his family after the tragic manifestation of his bestial abilities of accelerated healing factor, keenly enhanced senses and bone claws in each hand. Adopting the name Logan, he wandered the world, living a long life filled with blood, war and betrayal, having vile Sabretooth as his archenemy, and the Japanese warrior Ogun as his sensei. Unfortunately, by acting as a lone wolf, Logan was an unwitting subject of the Weapon X Program and had his bones coated in indestructible Adamantium, becoming an even more lethal asset. Rescued and assisted by Mac and Heather Hudson, he joined Department H as a Canadian government operative known as the Wolverine. Later, Logan was invited by Charles Xavier to join the X-Men, a team of heroes fighting for peace between humans and mutants. Proving to be a challenging addition to the X-Men due to his aggressive behavior, Wolverine was constantly in conflict with his fellow teammate Cyclops. However, he has gradually grown fond of the X-Men, considering them to be his new family. As a recurrent member of the X-Men, Wolverine has also become a noteworthy member of the Avengers.
abilities: Regenerative Healing Factor: Wolverine has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. Each two level up, the dice gets bigger until it reaches d12 at level 10. Then, an extra d4 is gained and the process repeats until level 19 is reached, where it gets 2d12. Additionally, he can regenerate body parts after losing them. If he is in possession of his lost limb, he can re-attach it and fixing time will be 1d10 minutes or, if in battle, 1d4 turns. If the limb is lost, he must wait an amount of 2d12 hours for it to fully grow again and, in the case of a hand or arm, a third of that time to partially grow and being able only to hold small objects. If he gets decapitated, he can stay alive if he succeeds on a Durability check of 23 and someone else must help him to reattach his head to his body. If in battle, the one helping him will spend an entire turn just helping him. If his body is lost, he can regrow h if he succeeds a Durability save of 25 and it will take him 3d12 hours to fully recover. When fallen he just needs two successes for waking up.
Skilled Tracker: Due to his superhuman sense, Wolverine is one of the world’s most skilled trackers. He can detect invisible, hidden, and stealth characters.
Foreign Chemical Resistant: Wolverine is resistant to poison damage attacks, and he is immune to “poisoned” status.

Telepathic Resistance: Thanks to his constant regeneration and the psychic blocks implanted by Professor X, Wolverine is resistant to psychic attacks, and he has a bonus of +3 when saving from telepathic control.
Slashing Finisher: If wolverine deals a full successful combo, his victim is left bleeding.

Adamantium Claws: Because of his claws, Wolverine’s normal attacks deal slashing damage instead of melee damage. In addition, if he gets a natural 19 throw or more on a normal attack, he will deal piercing damage and will leave the enemy bleeding. (If 20 he will deal a critical blow as usual)

Fury: Every time Wolverine attacks, he gains a fury point. When he earns 6 fury points, he enters in fury mode for 3 turns. When in fury mode, Wolverine can use his fury powers and his normal powers, his attack damage increases to 1d10 and he can deal critical blow with a natural 19 throw. Once finished these 3 turns, he loses his fury points and returns to normal. Wolverine can maintain his fury points after finishing a battle.
weaknesses: Sensory Overload. Because of his high senses, Wolverine is vulnerable to sonic damage and gets stunned for 1 turn when detecting strong odors.
Drowning: Of the few ways to kill Wolverine, given drowning cuts the brain's oxygen supply. He has admitted that being kept underwater can kill him, with the healing factor only prolonging the agony.

Muramasa Blade: Wolverine's only specific vulnerability known to date. Created by having his soul infused into the katana, the efficiency of his mutant healing factor is nullified if he sustains injury from the Muramasa Blade.

name: Cyclops
description: Scott Summers is a mutant with the ability to fire destructive optic beams from his eyes. As the first X-Man Cyclops, he has ascended from super hero field leader to a mutant revolutionary icon. As an introspective orphan and in the clutches of the nefarious Mister Sinister, his mutant abilities first manifested. After escaping Sinister's orphanage, Summers was rescued by Professor Xavier, a fellow mutant who ran a school aimed at helping mutants to control their uncanny abilities.As the leader of Xavier's X-Men, a task force with the goal of ensuring peaceful coexistence between humans and mutants, Cyclops guided other mutants in countless missions and adventures, and even became the headmaster of Xavier's School.
abilities: Energy Resistance: Energy attacks deal 20% less damage to him.
Expert Pilot: Cyclops is an expert pilot of fixed-wing aircraft, a skill he shares with his father. It has also been implied that his trigonometric sense improves his abilities in the air.
Spatial Awareness: Cyclops possesses an uncanny sense of trigonometry, in this sense used to describe his observation of objects around himself and the angles found between surfaces of these objects.

Master Tactician and Strategist: Cyclops has spent most of his superhero career as the leader of either the X-Men or X-Factor and has developed exceptional leadership skills. It is notable that regardless of their general attitude towards him, all of the X-Men tend to obey his orders in battle - because they know that he is usually right.

Multilingual: In addition to English, Cyclops is fluent in both Mandarin, Chinese and Russian. The former was telepathically taught to him by Emma Frost, while the latter was telepathically taught to him by Professor X

Telepathic Resistance: Years of being in intimate situations with telepaths have allowed Cyclops to hone his mind to the point where he can resist telepathic intrusion and withhold certain information from high level telepaths. He has +5 bonus on any throw when resisting mental control.

name: Jean Grey
description: Jean Grey is a mutant with vast empathic and telepathic abilities that were traumatically awakened when as a child she witnessed her best friend's death. For years, Jean Grey was mentored by mutant specialist Professor Charles Xavier, a telepath himself. Eventually, she also developed telekinetic powers. When Xavier opened a school for mutants in order to prepare his students to carry on his dream of peaceful coexistence between mutants and humans, Jean Grey was enrolled as the last student of his first class. As Marvel Girl, she became one of the original X-Men, a group that fights for a world that hates and fears mutants. Jean Grey is intimately associated with the Phoenix, an immensely powerful cosmic entity.
abilities: Psychic Immunity: Jean cannot be charmed, purple controlled or mentally controlled by other characters.
Mind Link: Jean Grey can communicate telepathically with other characters on a 180 ft. Radius.
Mind Transferal: She can transfer both her mind and powers into other host bodies if her own physical body was somehow killed.
Self Resurrection: If killed, Jean can attempt a Telepathy check of 18, if succeded, she will revive with 1 HP.
weaknesses: The Phoenix Avatar: During tense situations, Jean can lose control of herself, becoming possessed by the Phoenix Force. In these situations, the GM can ask her to make a saving throw of 15 Wisdom. If failed, Jean will become the Phoenix, and she won’t be able to be used as a Playable character. When using psychic phoenix there’s a 10% chance that she becomes the phoenix.

name: Beast
description: As a founding member of the X-Men, the intelligently gifted Dr. Hank McCoy has been fighting for the peaceful coexistence between mutants and humans for most of his life. Born with a physique, strength, and muscular structure greatly resembling an ape, he was known as Beast. He is considered one of the eight smartest people in the world, and has six PhDs, including one in biophysics. becoming a world-renowned biochemist, Later while working at the Brand Corporation, Hank drank a serum he created and further mutated himself into a blue-furred creature with fangs and claws. After spending many years as an Avenger, he joined the Defenders, and, later with his former teammates they formed X-Factor. Hank has always found himself returning to the X-Men
abilities: Lesser Healing Factor: Beast can heal faster than an average human. This allows him to heal 1d4 each turn. His dice turns into a d6 at level 10 and to a d10 on level 20.
Contaminant Resistant: Hank possesses a highly advanced immune system. Because of this, Beast in immune to being poisoned or irradiated.
Fine Blue Fur: Beast’s blue fur gives him heat, which makes him resistant to cold temperatures. Cold damage will deal half damage.
Telepathic Resistant: Beast can resist telepathic control. This makes him immune to being charmed and has a +5 bonus when saving against telepathic control.
Multilingual: He is fluent in several languages including English, German, French, Latin, Italian, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, and Russian as well as Latverian
Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Beast in a 15 ft. distance, he can use an opportunity attack even out of his turn.

Indomitable Will: As a result of a strong willpower, Beast has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. He is immune to purple control.
weaknesses: Vulnerable Senses: Due to his animal-like mutation, the only other 'weakness' that Beast has is the fact that his heightened senses can be taken advantage of. Because of this, he takes double damage when victim of sonic attacks.
Allergy: Beast claims to be allergic to sawdust.

Animal Instincts: For years, Hank McCoy has had to come to terms with his increasing animal instincts, which come with each new mutation. When drugged, drunk or frightened, Hank will attack his allies until the status effect wears off.

name: Iceman
description: Iceman is a mutant with the ability to lower both his external and internal body temperature, which projects intense coldness from his body. He is one of the Original X-Men. Bobby Drake discovered his mutant power to create ice while in his early teens, yet kept his condition hidden from everyone but his parents. Initially, Bobby was unable to stop feeling cold and shivering, but soon managed to keep it under control. Professor X dispatched his first X-Man, Cyclops, to contact Bobby. Hated and feared by humanity, the X-Men honed their amazing abilities while standing in defense of a world pushed to the brink of genetic war by a handful of mutant terrorists. Iceman, the team's youngest founding member, became known as the comedian of the group. Regardless, he pulled his weight and worked well with rest of the team.
abilities: Thermokinesis: Iceman is a mutant with the ability to lower both his external and internal body temperature, which projects intense coldness from his body. He can lower the temperature of his body to absolute zero.
Multilingual: Iceman is fluent in both English and Spanish.

Cellular Replacement: Iceman can use his control over moisture to draw ambient moisture into himself and thus use that moisture to replace his body’s cells, allowing him to heal from poisoning, irradiation and bleeding after just one turn. This also renders him immune to burning.
Thermal Vision: When lowering his body temperature, Iceman can see other beings via the heat signatures they give off because of the absence of heat around himself.
Ice Slide: Iceman uses his ice powers to create an ice path that he can use to ascend and move in the air at a speed of 20 ft. per turn.
