Ice Attack: Iceman’s normal attacks deal cold damage. If he deals a successful combo against a character, he will leave them frozen.

name: Angel
description: Warren Kenneth Worthington III is the mutant son of the wealthy Warren K. Worthington Jr. and his wife Kathryn, neither of whom were aware that their son had developed a pair of large feathered wings extending from his back enabling him to fly. Warren soon became the costumed crime-fighting Avenging Angel and attracted the attention of Professor Xavier, who recruited him as a founding member of the heroic, mutant X-Men team.
abilities: Archangel: Every time Angel attacks, he gains a Holly point. When he earns 4 Holly points, he transforms into archangel for 4 turns. When transformed, archangel can use his archangel powers and all his attacks do holly damage and have a bonus of 1d4 damage. Once finished these 4 turns, he loses his holly points and returns to his normal angel form. Angel can maintain his holly points after finishing a battle. When transformed in archangel, his flight skill and his defense are increased in one point.

Regenerative Healing Factor (Archangel): When transformed in Archangel, Warren has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. His dice increases into 1d6 at level 5, then 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 15 and 1d12 at level 20.

name: Storm
description: Ororo Munroe is a powerful mutant with weather-manipulating abilities, prestigiously known as the windriding Storm. As the daughter of a Kenyan tribal princess and an American photojournalist who lived in Cairo, Egypt, she became an orphan after a plane crashed on and destroyed her home. The young Ororo became a sneak thief on the streets of Cairo under the tutelage of Achmed El Gibár, who provided her a home. She was eventually approached by Professor Xavier to join his X-Men, a mutant group aimed at implementing peace between humans and mutants. Adopting the name Storm, Ororo accepted the offer, intending to comprehend the origin and potential of her powers. With the X-Men, Storm has had the opportunity to explore the universe in unexpected ways, rising to prominence in the group and becoming the leader of the team for years. Her challenging experiences have led her to connect herself to violent aspects of her soul she had never believed to possess. Storm also has strong ties with the nation of Wakanda, being its former queen due to her marriage to Black Panther.
abilities: SAtmokinesis: Storm is one of the most powerful mutants on Earth and has demonstrated a plethora of abilities, most of which are facets of her power to manipulate the weather. Storm possesses the psionic ability to control all forms of Weather Manipulation. She has been able to control both Earthly and extraterrestrial ecosystems on several occasions. She can modify the temperature of the environment, control all forms of precipitation, humidity, and moisture (at a molecular level).

The Power of Faith: Storm can get power from people's belief in and prayers to her. The more people that believe in her, the more powerful she becomes. For every character praying to her at a specific moment, she gets +2 on weather manipulation, strength, and Energy Projection.

Willpower/Telepathic Resistance: Something that was gradually gained through Ororo's time with the X-men, Storm has one of the most powerful wills of them all and is a powerful opponent against telepathy in battle. Her resistance is further enhanced by the electrical forces she controls. As a result of a strong willpower, Storm has an increased resistance against enemy temptations, giving him a +4 in his saving throws when defeated in tense situations once each long rest. She also gets a +5 bonus in any check when being charmed or telepathically controlled.

Radioactive Immune System: Due to his accelerated metabolism and radioactive blood, Spider-Man has higher tolerance for drugs and diseases than normal humans, giving him an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist diseases, drug effects and overdoses. Also, he saves in advantage when trying to resist curse diseases, such as vampirism. It’s harder for him to get drunk, but he doesn’t drink too much anyways. He throws in advantage to save from paralysis and can’t be irradiated
Energy Vision: With a blink, Storm can see the physical world around her as energy, including the human body's nervous system. She can see invisible, hidden, and stealth characters.
Expert Tactician: Storm has strong natural leadership skills and has lead teams of X-Men for years.
Expert Tactician: Storm has strong natural leadership skills and has lead teams of X-Men for years.
Multilingual: Storm is fluent in English, Arabic, Swahili, Russian, Japanese, Wakandan, and Yoruba.

Diplomatic Immunity: While married to T'Challa, the leader of a sovereign nation, she often visited the United States or the United Nations for political reasons. She enjoyed diplomatic immunity during these trips, and the Wakandan Embassy is considered foreign soil. She can’t go to jail.
weaknesses: Claustrophobia: Having been trapped under rubble for three days in Cairo while her mother lay dying, Storm's claustrophobia was once so severe, it rendered her completely helpless. Whenever she is trapped on small places, she becomes frightened.

Emotional Influence: Storm's ability to manipulate the weather in her immediate vicinity is affected by her emotions; hence, if she does not maintain control, a fit of rage might induce a destructive storm. As a result, Storm has in the past kept a tight rein on all extreme emotions. In a tense situation, the GM can ask storm for a wisdom check. If failed, she will create a destructive storm that damages foes and allies as well, dealing 2d10 damage to all of them.

Physical Condition: Storm is limited by the force of her will and the strength of her body. It once took her several hours to put an end to a savage blizzard sweeping over much of Canada, and she nearly killed herself from exhaustion in the process. Using her power continuously for more than 2 hours will start to drain her health in 20 hp per hour.

Naturally Occurring Limitation: Storm respects the natural boundaries of the planet's biosphere and manipulates weather patterns as they naturally exist. For example, she could end a drought in one area by creating torrential rains there, but that would necessitate robbing all available moisture from the surrounding area. (In contrast, Thor, whose weather affecting ability is magical, can change the weather in one area without disrupting existing weather patterns anywhere else). Storm does not typically create atmospheric conditions that cannot exist naturally on the planet she is on. She could not, for example, lower temperatures as far as absolute zero or raise them to solar intensities.

name: Nightcrawler
description: Kurt Wagner is a demonic-looking mutant with teleporting abilities, being known as the soft-hearted X-Man Nightcrawler. As the child of the terrorist Mystique and the Neyaphem leader Azazel, he was abandoned after birth in the Bavarian Alps. Found and raised by the Romani witch Margali Szardos, he lived a happy childhood despite his devilish appearance, performing as a trapeze artist in the carnival alongside his adoptive siblings Jimaine and Stefan. After Stefan became a vile mass-murderer in Winzeldorf, Kurt unintentionally executed his own brother. Their conflict caught the attention of a mob, who believed Kurt to be a murderous demon and decided to hunt and lynch him. Kurt was ultimately saved by Professor Charles Xavier of the X-Men, who invited him to join the super hero mutant group under the name Nightcrawler. He has become one of the most respected and beloved members of the X-Men, due to his charming attitude and kind soul. Considering the X-Men his family, he even led the team in several opportunities. Nightcrawler was also a prominent member and leader of the British-based mutant group Excalibur for years.
abilities: Camouflage: Kurt has limited abilities to blend into shadows, both because of his indigo fur and his connection to the light-bending attributes of the dimension through which he teleports. Because of this, he has +5 stealth in dark places.
Night Vision: Nightcrawler's always glowing eyes grant him a marked degree of heightened night vision as well.
Aviator: He has served as the team's pilot and, with Wolverine, has also been the mechanic of the X-Men's Blackbird jet for a long time.
Katanas: Nightcrawler has 2 katanas in his basic equipment.
Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Kurt in a 15 ft. distance, he can use an opportunity attack even out of his turn.
Medic: As a medic he can help reviving a fallen character, which gives them advantage when saving, and adds the medicine bonus.

Prehensile Tail: Nightcrawler has a tail allows him to grab onto objects with relative ease. His tail is strong enough to not only support his body weight but also lift an adult man completely off the ground. It is deft enough to fight with like a sword or blunt object.

Multilingual: Nightcrawler is fluent in various languages due to his youth traveling as the star performer in a circus. He was a member of the X-Men when Professor Xavier telepathically taught them Russian and Japanese. Kurt also speaks English, French, Spanish, Krakoan, and Italian, as well as his native German.
weaknesses: Bamf Limitations: It is very difficult for nightcrawler to bamf more than 20 ft upwards or to teleport with more than 2 people. If he tries, he must rest for some minutes or for 5 turns if in battle to be able to Bamf again.

name: Rogue
description: The mutant known as Rogue has the uncontrollable ability of absorbing the energy of others through physical contact, temporarily incorporating their abilities, powers, memories and even personality with a touch, a process which wears her victims out. A runaway, Rogue was found and adopted by mutant terrorists Mystique and Destiny. She had her abilities traumatically activated when she shared her first kiss with a boy and put him into a coma. As part of Mystique's Brotherhood of Evil Mutants Rogue accidentally learned through Destiny that the super-heroine Ms. Marvel was destined to bring tragedy to their life. Deciding to secretly attack Ms. Marvel, Rogue unexpectedly absorbed her entire persona, permanently keeping not only her flight and super-strength powers but also her psyche. Gravely affected by this experience, Rogue had no choice but to seek help with Mystique's enemy, Professor Charles Xavier, founder and leader of the X-Men. Contrary to other members' disapproval, Xavier took Rogue in as part of the team. Rogue soon proved her worth by becoming one of Xavier's most loyal soldiers by not being afraid of putting herself in danger to protect others. With the X-Men she found relative peace and even managed to get rid of Ms. Marvel's identity. A notable super hero, Rogue was also a member of the Avengers Unity Division, a team designed to improve mutant-human relations, eventually becoming the leader of the team. After getting married to her long-time teammate and lover, Gambit, Rogue started to enjoy options to keep her powers in check.
abilities: Ms Marvel Strength: After absorbing Ms. Marvel’s (Carol Danvers) powers, Rogue gained better fighting skills, which allows her to use her strength when attempting a melee check in combat.
weaknesses: Multi-mind: Rogue doesn’t always absorb just a physical attribute, she can also absorb the very essence of a person, meaning personality traits and memories. Each time Rogue uses her absorbing powers, she must make a Wisdom save of 7 or she receives 1d10 psychic damage and will absorb personality traits of her victim. This means that if her victim is purely evil (Not all villains are), she may turn evil as well for a equal amount of time. If her victim is insane and she suffers a multi-mind, the psychic damage is doubled.

Untouchable: Rogue’s absorption power is something she can’t control, meaning she will always use her power with anyone she has direct skin contact with, intentionally or not. If contact is not intentional, it will automatically count as a grapple, and both will have to make a roll. Rogue must make an Agility save and the target must make either a Strength or an Agility save. If the target’s roll is higher than 25 – Rogue's roll, the contact will be terminated. However, each turn contact remains, the target will suffer damage as described in power absorb.

name: Gambit
description: Remy LeBeau, better known as the charming thief Gambit, is a mutant with the ability to charge inanimate objects and cause them to explode. Raised by the Thieves Guild, Gambit's dark path led him to become a secret agent for the vile Mister Sinister. After befriending fellow mutant thief, Storm, he was invited to the X-Men, and had the opportunity to redeem himself. Although he morally conflicted with much of the X-Men's way of acting, Gambit's soft spot for abandoned kids caused him to integrate well into the team while getting close to many of its members, especially Rogue whom he developed a romance with. Although a longtime member of the X-Men, upon the public reveal of his association with Sinister, the X-Men rejected his membership, though he eventually made it back to the team.
abilities: Opportunist: When someone falls prone to opportunity attack and is close to Gambit in a 15 ft. distance, he can use an opportunity attack even out of his turn.
Multilingual: He is fluent in English and Cajun French. He also knows some Japanese though he is not very fluent.
Equipment: Gambit uses his staff in his basic equipment.
Master Stick Fighter: Remy's extreme skills in bojutsu makes him dangerously skilled in the use of his bo staff.
Master Thief: Remy has a remarkable past as a very skilled thief.

name: Colossus
description: Born to a simple farm life in Russia, Piotr Rasputin (Russian: Пётр Распутин) was the younger brother of the famous cosmonaut Mikhail Rasputin. Gifted as an artist, Piotr was content with his simple life, until he was approached with a chance to change the world by Professor Charles Xavier. Since joining the X-Men as Colossus (Russian: Колосс), Piotr has been using his mutant power to turn to organic steel and gain superhuman strength to fight for the peaceful coexistence of mutants and humans most of his life. When the X-men battled the Hellfire Club Knights and the White Queen, where Piotr first met Kitty Pryde. Piotr began a close friendship with Wolverine and Nightcrawler as well as Storm, whom would come to affectionately call him Little Brother.
abilities: Multilingual: Peter is fluent in both his native language of Russian and English. He was also telepathically taught Japanese by Professor X, along with the other X-Men who traveled to Japan to attend Wolverine's wedding.
Skilled Painter: Peter is a talented artist adept in both sketching and painting, once becoming very famous using the name Peter Nicholas.

Expert Combatant: Even though Peter has a gentle demeanor and personality, he is a skilled hand to hand combatant who utilizes judo and wrestling techniques. He also received some training personally from Wolverine and honed himself through years of combat training within the X-Men's Danger Room.
weaknesses: Vibranium: Colossus receives double damage from vibranium objects, and when attacked with these objects his defense reduces in 4 points, as he returns to his normal form
Adamantium:  Colossus receives double damage from adamantium weapons.

name: Emma Frost
description: Emma Frost is a powerful and influential mutant telepath, most notoriously known as the White Queen of the Hellfire Club and occasional headmistress of the Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters. Born to a rich Boston mercantile family, she parted ways with her family and built a financial empire with Frost International, ascending to a ruling position in the Inner Circle of the Hellfire Club. Demonstrating a particular interest in education, Frost ran the Massachusetts Academy, a preparatory school that secretly housed young mutants trained for her own interests, the Hellions. As an adversary of Charles Xavier's X-Men, Frost constantly used to clash with younger mutants she attempted to manipulate, such as Kitty Pryde, and members of the New Mutants and the New Warriors. However, the tragic death of her Hellions changed her heart, leading her to form a partnership with Xavier.
abilities: Mind Link: Emma can communicate telepathically with other characters on a 180 ft. Radius.
CRP: Emma has a little knowledge of CRP techniques, which gives her advantage when reviving a fallen character.

Expert Technician: Emma Frost is highly skilled in electronic theory and electronics and has learned how to exactly build devices that can amplify psionic energy and utilize psionic energy for various effects. She devised the mechanism by which Mastermind projected his illusions directly into the mind of the Phoenix Force.
weaknesses: Familial Immunity: As seen during her various attempts to enter Adrienne's mind, Emma's telepathic powers are unable to read or affect her sister's mind.

name: Kitty Pride
description: Kitty Pryde is a Jewish mutant with versatile phasing abilities which allow her to move through solid matter. After her powers first manifested, Pryde was approached both by Emma Frost, the White Queen of the Hellfire Club, and the X-Men, a mutant super hero group. Realizing Frost had vile intentions as she captured and tortured the X-Men, Pryde demonstrated immense bravery and freed the X-Men. As Sprite, she became the X-Men's youngest member by enrolling at the Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters.Proving to be a controversial but invigorating addition to the team, Pryde had her life completely guided by her tenure with the X-Men, who became her second family.
abilities: Multilingual: She speaks fluent Japanese, Russian, the royal and standard languages of the Shi'ar Empire, and Skrullos. She also has moderate expertise in Gaelic and knows a couple words in Hebrew.
Dance Training: Kitty is trained in ballet and modern dance. She continued to take dance training under the tutelage of Stevie Hunter and was highly agile.
Telepathic Resistance: When using her phasing powers or her phasing form, Shadowcat is resistant to telepathic and psychic powers.
weaknesses: Magic: While phasing Shadowcat may be still vulnerable to mystical and magic attacks.

name: Jubilee
description: Jubilation Lee, also known as Jubilee, is a mutant born with the ability to generate explosive energy blasts, often referred to as fireworks. After her parents were killed, Jubilee was sent to an orphanage, but ran away and hid in a Hollywood shopping mall. Eventually, she was caught by mall security, but was rescued by the X-Men and decided to follow them through a portal to their base in Australia, ending up joining the team. As an X-Man, Jubilee formed a close bond with Wolverine and carried his teachings with her when she joined the teenage mutant team called Generation X.
abilities: Skilled Combatant: Jubilee is skilled in gymnastics. She is also a good hand-to-hand combatant, having received training from Wolverine and later with Generation X.
Glow in the dark: Jubilee can emit energy to glow in dark environments.
Potential for leadership: Jubilee seems to have the makings of a good leader.
weaknesses: Dyscalculia: Jubilee has severe difficulty when making arithmetical calculations.

name: Psylocke
description: Elizabeth “Betsy” Braddock is a British mutant telepath who has acted both alongside the X-Men as Psylocke, and as a champion for Otherworld as Captain Britain. While her twin brother Brian became the original Captain Britain, Betsy developed psychic powers. By serving in S.T.R.I.K.E. Psi Division, her path as a secret agent crossed with her brother's super hero activities. She acted as an ally to her brother in several conflicts, eventually adopting the Captain Britain mantle. Blinded by the villain Slaymaster, Braddock stood down as Captain Britain, only to be captured and to have her sight restored by Mojo and Spiral. Rescued by the New Mutants and the X-Men, Braddock joined the ranks of the latter as Psylocke.
abilities: Precognition: Betsy's psychic abilities originally manifested as precognitive dreams. The master can use this power to reveal her premonitions.
Reality Anchoring: Betsy's brother, Jamie Braddock, had altered her at a quantum level to make her more resilient to magic. Magic attacks against her deal half damage.
Trained pilot: Betsy worked as a charter pilot, being experienced in controlling airplanes.
Psychic Resistance: Psylocke is resistant to being charmed, purple controlled or mentally controlled by other characters. Every attempt to do this on her will be thrown on disadvantage.
Mind Link: Betsy can communicate telepathically with other characters on a 180 ft. Radius.

name: Professor X
description: Charles Xavier is a mutant gifted with vast telepathic powers, a specialist in mutant biology and sociology and the founder of the Uncanny X-Men as Professor X. With immense support from Dr. Moira MacTaggert, his life has become dedicated to fulfilling his dream of mutants and humans coexisting peacefully. As a young man, he traveled around the world to better comprehend mutantkind, meeting a dear friend and ruthless rival, the man who would become known as Magneto. After becoming paraplegic following a conflict against the villain Lucifer in the Himalayas, Xavier transformed his family's ancestral home into the Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters, a sanctuary for mutants to train and learn about their abilities.[28] Under his supervision, Professor X's students formed the first X-Men, a super hero group who fight for a world that hates and fears them, guided by Xavier's dream.
abilities: Omnilingual: As a result of his telepathic abilities, Xavier can communicate with any individual, regardless of languages barriers.
Psychic Resistance: Charles is resistant to being charmed, purple controlled or mentally controlled by other characters. Every attempt to do this on her will be thrown on disadvantage.

Mind Link: Charles can communicate telepathically with any other characters on a 180 ft. Radius. He can make a link with allies which allows him to communicate with them anywhere in the same dimension if they are not telepathically cloaking.

Military Training: Charles served in the United States Military, secretly employing his abilities to specialize in search and rescue missions. Despite not being able to use his physical training, he has some skills that can be used when commanding the X-Men
weaknesses: Paraplegic: Professor X is paraplegic; he cannot do any action that require the use of his legs. He moves around with his wheelchair. He requires help to go upstairs or to get through obstacles. If thrown away, or if he received an attack that would leave him prone, he may fall from his chair. When this happens, he will only be able to move by crawling at a speed of 10 ft, until sitting back on his chair.

name: Havok
description: Alexander Summers is the younger of the two sons of Christopher Summers, a United States Air Force Major and test pilot, and his wife Katherine Anne. His brother is Cyclops, the leader of the X-Men. After his parent's death Alex was soon adopted by the Blanding family, who had lost their son Todd. Alex was one day captured by one of the mutant-hunting robotic Sentinels and brought to the headquarters of Larry Trask, son of the Sentinels' inventor Bolivar Trask. Larry gave Alex the codename Havok and a costume whose chest display monitored the build-up of cosmic energy within him. The X-Men came to Alex’s rescue and he finally returned with his brother and his teammates. He joined the X-Men and began training to control his powers. Eventually, Alex gained enough mastery over his power that he would release it only when he wished to do so and could wield his power with enough skill to become a formidable opponent in battle.
abilities: Energy Absorption: Havok is immune and can absorb any energy, laser, heat, radioactive or fire attack thrown against him. Absorbing any of these attacks heals him in half the damage they would normally do and increases his next plasma emanation or directed plasma emanation in 1d8.
Heat immunity: Havok cannot get the burned status effect.
Radiation immunity: Havok cannot get the irradiated status effect.
weaknesses: Uncontrolled energy conversion: Every turn, Havok has 5% chance of automatically release a plasma emanation. If he absorbs energy 4 times without using a plasma emanation, it will be used automatically.

Genetic Flaw: Havok is not immune to Vulcan's powers, but is partially resistant to it by way of his ability to absorb energy. Havok is immune to Cyclops' optic blasts as Cyclops is immune to his powers. The brothers are also immune to the powers of their half-brother Adam-X, and Adam-X is immune to theirs.

name: Magik
description: Illyana Rasputin is a mutant sorceress who rules the demonic realm known as Limbo. Magik (as she's known in the superhero community) became a demon lord following a tragic experience. As the younger sister of the X-Man Colossus, she was forcedly taken to Limbo by the malignant Belasco when she was under the X-Men's custody. In the very few seconds that passed on Earth, Rasputin aged years in Limbo, a process which caused her to master different dark arts. Back to the X-Men, Magik exhibited mutant teleporting abilities linked to Limbo and ultimately joined Charles Xavier's younger protegees, the New Mutants. Having the New Mutants not only as her teammates but also as her close friends, Magik experienced many unimaginable adventures and difficult moments. Her usually mischievous attitude always masked a deeply traumatized and lonely soul.
abilities: Soulsword: Magik uses the soulsword as her basic equipment, she can invoke it to appear in her hand anytime. It cannot accidentally harm non-magical beings. It can attack intangible an ethereal beings, such as astral forms, or characters with phasing abilities like vision or Kitty Pride.

Multilingual: Native Russian born Illyana was telepathically taught fluent English by Professor X over the course of a single night by programming it into her brain while she slept. She also speaks demonic.
Ancient Weapon Master: Illyana is also highly skilled in ancient weaponry, typically axes and swords
Light and Dark: Magik is highly skilled in the black magic of Limbo granted by the patron of Belasco, Chthon, as well as white magic of Earth granted by the patron of Storm's lineage Oshtur.
weaknesses: Mystical Limitations: Magik's magical abilities are far more limited in Earth's dimension. She did not formally train as a sorcerer on Earth when younger, so does not fully understand her power, and is ignorant of even some basic concepts of Earth magic.

Dark Half: Use of dark magic or intense emotions can cause a demonic 'Darkchylde' form within her. On stressful situations or when using dark magic, the master can ask Magik for a wisdom check. If failed, she transforms into the 'Darkchylde' and will attack her party.

name: Bishop
description: Lucas Bishop is a mutant born in a dystopic future who has travelled back in time and has joined the legendary mutants he had only known through bedtime stories, the X-Men. In his original timeline, Bishop served as a member of the X.S.E. mutant police force. Chasing the criminal Fitzroy, Bishop entered an intertemporal portal and arrived decades prior to his own birth. With the X-Men, he reconsidered his authoritarian upbringing and found a family to get support from and rely on. Bishop's police training has directed him to approach mutant-human relations under a law-enforcement approach, joining the X-Treme X-Men, Storm's X.S.E., and O*N*E*, and by acting as a peacekeeper in Mutant Town. In an unexpected turn of events, Bishop betrayed the X-Men following the birth of Hope, the mutant messiah who was claimed to have caused his world to systematically prosecute mutants. After hunting Hope for years, Bishop has eventually met his redemption by regretting his actions.
abilities: Energy Absorption: Bishop is immune and can absorb any energetic damage attack thrown against him. For each 10 hp damage absorbed, he gains 1 energy point that can be spent in his powerset or to increase in 1 damage dice any weapon he uses. He can decide whether or how many points he will spend when using energy points.
Psionic Resistance: Bishop can absorb psionic energy. He is resistant to psychic attacks, and telelpathic powers against him are thrown in disadvantage.
Magic Energy Resistance: Bishop is resistant to attacks of magic energy, which deal half damage  to him and grant him 1 energy point if hit. However, he is not immune to being affected by spells.
Energy Status immunity: Bishop is immune to being irradiated and burned.
Poison Resistance: Bishop is immune to being poisoned, and bad poisons do half damage against him.
Weapon equipment: Bishop has a X.S.E gun as part of weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions.
weaknesses: Energy Overload: When Bishop accumulates 10 energy points, he will receive 2d10 energy damage and will cause a 30 ft radius explosion that deals 2d10 energy damage to every character on this area.

name: Deadpool
description: Welcome to the Deadpool character bio, nerds! I mean...True Believers! Brought to you by me, myself, and I: the fabulous Deadpool! I could have let some smelly pencil-pushing intern spell out my life story for you, but you deserve better. So, here it is, straight from the Merc with a Mouth's mouth—every detail of my morally ambiguous, mentally unstable, innuendo-laden past. From my very first appearance in NEW MUTANTS #98, to my latest booty-kicking, comic relief-ing anti-heroics, to a third thing that I can't think of right now, this is the definitive history of Deadpool. Like any misunderstood hero, I probably had a difficult childhood that led to my career as a professional killer. That, or someone brainwashed me into murdering my parents. If I don't remember, does it really count? Or matter?. Let's just say that I was an orphan, a wizard put me on my aunt and uncle's doorstep, they raised me in secret, and then I went to a special magic school where a bald man regularly tried to murder me with voodoo. Okay, that's not true...but I do have a scar on my forehead! Several, actually! Anyway, seriously, I joined the military at 17 years-old, but was discharged soon thereafter. So, naturally, I decided to become an assassin (which is, by the way, an incredibly fun word to write). Then I met Wade and Mercedes Wilson, a young couple that nursed me back to health after an early failed job. Some may say that I killed them both in an attempt to steal Wade's identity, but guys, come on. I'm the real Wade Wilson. While working as a hired gun, I met the expensively beautiful Vanessa Carlyle, and we made a perfectly dysfunctional pair. I then got an assignment to kill a British operative named Althea (important moment readers, I'm meeting my best friend here) but decided to kill everyone else instead. Doing this made my employers...unhappy. So they tried to kill Vanessa. Luckily, a special agent named Zoe Culloden—who'd been spying on me to try and convert me into some kind of messiah protector—rescued Vanessa. Weird subplot, I know. Cue my first life-defining moment: they gave me inoperable cancer. Low blow. I dumped Vanessa and joined a Weapon X program, where a few experiments served me up fresh and cancer free—with a side order of healing powers. Mmm, tasty! I joined their internal team of mercenaries, but my powers had some performance issues, so the department sent me off to die quietly in a place called Hospice. As if a painful, slow death could shut this mouth up. Clearly, these guys hadn't read any of my supporting literature. There were a few other guys stuck in there with me, and we had a betting pool over who would kick the bucket first. We called it the dead pool, and because I'm a clever girl and because my name needed some kind of logic behind it, I adopted the moniker Deadpool. What? No, I disagree, it's not a reach at all. I got many enemies with the years, and many people have tried to kill me. But it didn't work because I'm still here. Writing this character biography. Doing work an intern should be doing. Not getting paid. In any case, if you are going to play as me. Do it right! Or I'll get out of this game and I'll kill you, and you know I will! Okay. Uhh? How do I end this. Umm? Oh! I know. The truth is... I am Iron Man.
abilities: Regenerative Healing Factor: Deadpool has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. Each two level up, the dice gets bigger until it reaches d12 at level 9. Then, an extra d4 is gained and the process repeats until level 19 is reached, where it gets 2d12. Additionally, he can regenerate body parts after losing them. If he is in possession of his lost limb, he can re-attach it and fixing time will be 1d10 minutes or, if in battle, 1d4 turns. If the limb is lost, he must wait an amount of 1d20 hours for it to fully grow again and, in the case of a hand or arm, a third of that time to partially grow and being able only to hold small objects. If he gets decapitated, he can stay alive if he succeeds on a Durability check of 23 and someone else must help him to reattach his head to his body. If in battle, the one helping him will spend an entire turn just helping him. If his head is lost, he can regrow it if he succeeds a Durability save of 25 and it will take him 3d12 hours to fully recover. If fallen, he just needs two successes to wake up.
Multilingual: Deadpool is fluent in Spanish, Japanese, German, and Esperanto.
Foreign Chemical Resistant: Deadpool is resistant to radioactive or poison damage attacks, and he is immune to “poisoned” and “irradiated” status. He is also immune to most earth diseases.

Telepathic Immunity: Deadpool’s healing factor causes his brain to be in a constant state of flux and regeneration, which renders him immune to be telepathically controlled and psychic damage. He can’t be charmed either.

Medium Awareness: After accidentally being transported to the Foundation of Reality, Deadpool became consciously aware that he is a fictional character, allowing him to break the fourth wall. He doesn't always possess this ability due to the constant changes in his brain, but it gives him the opportunity to speak directly to the DM once per long rest.

Weapons Master: Deadpool is proficient in the use of all kinds of weaponry. Also, he can unsheathe weapons with both hands during combat with no Action penalty and his Bonus Action allows him to change weapons on both hands.

Unpredictability: Given that not even Deadpool himself knows what he’ll do next, nobody can predict his movements or actions, meaning that he can disengage without being vulnerable to opportunity attacks.
Possession Immunity: Deadpool is immune to possession. You can’t touch his soul.

Teleportation Device: Deadpool's belt buckle is in reality a teleportation device that allows him to teleport anywhere in sight on a 20 ft radius as a bonus action. The device contains a built-in gauge that shows how many times can the device be used. Initially, the device only has one use before emptying out, but as Deadpool levels up, the device also improves, adding an additional use at levels 5, 10, 15 and 20. Each use takes 4 seconds to recharge, or a full turn, when in combat, and if the gauge goes to zero then the device has to recharge fully before being usable again. Deadpool can also spend more than one use at a time to achieve a greater teleportation distance, adding 20 more ft but spending another use. If Deadpool wants to use any of the additional uses to go to a place that was not in sight from his initial position, he must save to 15 Agility or the teleportation chain will be interrupted and he will no longer be able to teleport on that same turn. (He can perform an additional save to 20 Luck at the GM discretion). This device can also be used to evade an upcoming attack as a reaction. However, he needs to achieve a perception check higher than the attacker’s throw and it spends three uses of the device.
Weapon equipment: Deadpool has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions, including 2 Katanas, 2 Pistols, 2 Flash Grenades, 1 Frag Grenade and 1 Incendiary Grenade
weaknesses: Scrambled Brain: As a result of his constant brain regeneration, along with his previous mental issues and the fact he’s an idiot, Deadpool suffers from great mental instability, forcing him to do something stupid from time to time. On these occasions, the player must save to intelligence to resist the stupidity impulse.
Older Avocado: Deadpool is ugly as $#*!, meaning he has to stay with his mask on at all times. When he takes it off, his Charisma instantly drops to -4 but his intimidation increases to 5.
Phobias: Deadpool is terrified to cows, clowns, and chickens. If he sees one of these, he gets “frightened” status effect.

name: Cable
description: Nathan Summers is a powerful mutant telepath and telekinetic, who has been fighting in wars most of his life as the time-travelling soldier called Cable. The son of the first X-Man Cyclops and Madelyne Pryor, Nathan's maternally-inherited powers manifested at a young age. The circumstances of his birth were machinated by Mr. Sinister to create a living weapon against Apocalypse, which resulted in his mother's descent into madness and death after learning her place in this plot as a clone of his eventual step-mother, founding X-Man Jean Grey. During this ordeal, baby Nathan was infected with the Techno-Organic Virus and sent into a post-apocalyptic future where he could be saved. Raised in this future as Nathan Dayspring, the Askani'son destined to kill Apocalypse in the Clan Askani religion, Nathan became a hardened warrior and brilliant tactician.
abilities: Psychic Immunity: Cable cannot be charmed or mentally controlled by other characters.
Mind Transferal: Cable can transfer both his mind and powers into other host bodies if his own physical body was somehow killed.
Mind Link: Cable can communicate telepathically with other characters on a 180 ft. Radius.

Telepathic Immunity: Deadpool’s healing factor causes his brain to be in a constant state of flux and regeneration, which renders him immune to be telepathically controlled and psychic damage. He can’t be charmed either.
Precognition: During a play session, the GM can allow Cable to foresee future events before they have even come to pass.
Weapon equipment: Cable has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions, including his Psmitar, a Plasma Rifle, 2 Incendiary Grenades, 2 Knifes and 1 Incendiary Mine
weaknesses: Mind's Interconnection: The minds of Cable and Nate Grey (X-Man) are interconnected, causing them great pain when they in close proximity to each other.

Techno-Organic Virus: Cable must constantly sacrifice a portion of his telekinetic powers by being required to use them to restrain the T-O Virus from spreading. An excessive effort could release the Virus, and cause him to die slowly, turned into a cyborg. A master can, at any times, but not very often, ask Cable for a Durability check of 10, if failed, the virus will spread, dealing 3d20 damage.

name: Domino
description: The woman who would become known as Domino was actually the result of a top-secret government breeding program intended to develop the perfect weapon, the clandestine super-soldier program Project Armageddon. There she was subjected to tests by Dr. Rossini, which included at one point being given a cat she named Christmas. Domino was the only test subject to survive, but her luck power was deemed a failure to meet the project's goals. Domino's biological mother broke her out of the project and left her with Father Rudolpho Boschelli, in the Church of the Sacred Heart in Chicago. Domino eventually escaped from the Church and became a mercenary.
abilities: Probability Manipulation: Domino is a mutant with the ability to subliminally and psionically initiate random kinetic phenomena that affect probability in her favor by making improbable (but not impossible) things to occur within her line of sight, thus causing her to have good luck and her opponents to have bad luck. Every action attempted by her can be thrown using the luck skill, and every action attempted against her will be thrown in disadvantage. The GM must have in mind that her success in different scenarios is not due to her skill, and it is just pure luck. Domino cannot consciously control her ability, so it’s only up to the game master to tell how the events unfold. However, it is also largely participatory - for the luck to take effect, Domino herself must engage in an action whose chance she can affect. For example, if debris falling from the sky was about to hit her in the head, she would still be hurt if she stood still. However, if she tried to avoid them, she would move perfectly to avoid each piece about to hit her. In addition, if Domino were to stand before a hail of bullets, she would be a bullet-ridden corpse. Instead, she must act; in attempting to avoid the gunfire, she will miraculously dodge just right to avoid every single shot.
Weapon equipment: Domino has special weapon equipment that she gets at the beginning of his missions. Including a Beretta M9, 1 Flash Grenade and a Dagger

Master Markswoman: Neena is extremely skilled in hitting her targets with effortless accuracy and sometimes uses her probability manipulation to make impossible shots, any marksman check has advantage.
weaknesses: Alektorophobia: Domino has a crippling fear of chickens.

name: Blade
description: There are many men and women in the world who hunt vampires, but few strike as much fear into bloodsucking hearts as they do stakes. Blade is more than just a slayer of the undead, but a boogeyman’s boogeyman, the thing that makes ghouls and monsters lose sleep. Born from a mother ravaged by vampirism and gifted super human abilities by a bite from Morbius, the Living Vampire, Blade is the Daywalker—a skilled martial artist who possesses most vampire strengths and none of their weaknesses. His life is the tireless pursuit of eradicating the world of the beasts who seek to destroy innocent life.
abilities: Skilled Tracker: Due to his superhuman sense, Blade is one of the world’s most skilled trackers. He can detect invisible, hidden, and stealth characters.
Multilingual: Blade is fluent in English, German, Romanian, Japanese.
Lesser Healing Factor: Blade can heal faster than an average human. This allows him to heal 1d4 each turn. His dice turns into a d6 at level 10 and to a d10 on level 20.
Prolonged Lifespan: Although not a pure vampire, he does have the advantage of being a Hybrid. This includes a Pseudo-Immortality, greatly enhanced lifespan.
Expert Marksman: He can throw most projectile weaponry with great aim and is well-versed in the use of firearms.
Expert Swordsman: His particular specialty is the use of edged weapons, be they teakwood daggers or swords.
Weapon equipment: Blade has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions, including 1 Katana, 1 Flash Grenade, 3 Daggers and a Baretta M9

Weapons Proficiency: Blade is practically proficient in every form of weaponry known to man. His particular speciality is the use of edged weapons, be they teakwood daggers or swords. Blade is a master in the use of small bladed weapons and can hurl knives with great accuracy. Blade also shows great skill with firearms, including both automatic and semi-automatic, which he often modifies to fire hollow-point, garlic-filled silver bullets.
weaknesses: Blood Thirst: Blade does possess one weakness common to all vampires, which is the need to ingest fresh blood to stay alive. However, rather than consume blood, he ingests or injects a specially designed serum that provides even better nourishment that blood would provide. If Blade doesn't drink the serum for an extended period, he will weaken, and his self-control will be stretched. When on this conditions, Blade’s health is reduced in half, and he must save to 15 wisdom. if failed, he will try to attack a near human for consuming their blood.

name: Venom
description: Eddie Brock is the former-villain-turned-hero Venom. Starting his career as a failed reporter unwittingly due to the actions of Spider-Man, he would go to Our Lady of Saints Church to ask God forgiveness before attempting suicide. However, a symbiote that was earlier discarded there by Spider-Man sensed his anger and merged with him, becoming one of the deadliest foes of Spider-Man. Going by the alias of Venom, he would give birth to another symbiote that bonded with the serial killer Cletus Kasady to become Carnage. For a time, Eddie agreed to a truce with Spider-Man and moved to San Francisco, where he became the anti-heroic Lethal Protector of an Underground City, but returned to villainy following a failed stint as a black ops government assassin. Parting ways with the Venom symbiote, Eddie began to seek redemption for his dark past - bonding to the Anti-Venom and Toxin symbiotes, before finally returning as Venom and attempting to become a true hero.
abilities: Symbiote Prosthetic: If Eddie is already missing a limb, Venom/Anti-Venom can recreate it as a symbiote prosthetic and maintain it indefinitely while possessing the symbiote and, when separating from it, losing said limb again.

Regenerative Symbiote Healing: Venom has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. His dice increases into 1d6 at level 5, then 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 15 and 1d12 at level 20. He can instantly reattach body parts after losing them or, if in battle, spend a turn for it. If he gets decapitated, he can stay alive if he succeeds on a Durability save of 25. This power is only effective while wearing the symbiote suit. If fallen, he just needs two successes to wake up.

ESP: Venom possesses an extrasensory ability like a Spider-Sense, meaning he can’t be attacked by surprise. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. He doesn’t have to check perception against invisible characters.
Spider-Sense Immunity: Being previously bonded to Spider-man, Venom developed the ability to act without activating Spider-man's Spider-Sense, and due to the genetic memory, so can Anti-Venom.
Web-Swinging: As a bonus action, Venom can move 60 ft. with his organic web swinging ability.
Disguise: Venom can morph his external appearance to resemble another person. For this, he must pass a Charisma check of 15. Also, the symbiote can transform into any kind of non-armor clothing.

Constituent-Matter Manipulation: As a bonus action, Venom can morph his body parts into all kinds of melee weapons or enlarge his fists, giving him 1d8 extra damage on regular melee attacks. This can be used only once per battle and will last for four turns. If venom uses web warrior, poisonous fangs, web snare or web swinging, this effect will deactivate immediately. When picking up a breakable item while on this state, he must save to 16 agility. If failed, the item will break.

Enhanced Immune System: Due to the symbiote’s healing properties, Venom has a higher tolerance for diseases and higher cure probability than normal humans, giving him an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist and an extra d8 when trying to cure.

Genetic Memory: The symbiote possesses some psychic ability, being capable of establishing a neural connection between its host and another character by direct physical contact, enabling him to effectively read minds.

Dual Mind: Venom possesses two consciousness in his mind, Eddie Brock’s and the symbiote’s. This results in a higher chance of defending from a telepathic attack, meaning he can save in advantage whenever an opponent tries to telepathically attack him. Also, if Eddie Brock’s mind is subdued, the symbiote will take over the body and will still be free of said control.

Organic Matter Assimilation: Venom can eat any organic corpse to increase his muscular mass, giving him 1d4 extra damage to his normal attack for each corpse he eats for the rest of the battle. Eating a corpse is 1 full cation.  It frightens the closest enemy to Venom.
weaknesses: Sensitive Hearing: Venom is vulnerable to loud sounds and high frequencies. This means that whenever he receives sonic damage, it will be counted as critical. When hit with a sound attack, his attacks are made in disadvantage for a turn and his Defense drops to 5, for a turn as well.

Fire: Venom is vulnerable to fire. Whenever he is attacked with fire attacks, he will receive double damage. Also, his attacks are made in disadvantage for a turn and if he gets “burned” status effect, he will get all his stats halved, rounded to down, until the effect is removed.

Mental Instability: Due to neural interactions with the symbiote producing aggression and power addiction, Venom has a small chance of turning hostile towards his allies in middle of a battle. This probability is according to the player’s interaction with the symbiote and will be determined by the GM.

name: Agent Venom
description: Flash Thompson is a bully-turned selfless-soldier better known as Agent Anti-Venom. Initially the high school tormentor of Peter Parker, whose secret alter-ego of the super hero Spider-Man also happened to be Flash's biggest idol, Thompson grew out of his abusive behavior and befriended Peter in college. Flash joined the Army and was stationed in Southeast Asia, but had trouble finding a place to fit when he returned to the States. Flash spiralled into depression and combated alcoholism,[23] an addiction that was exploited by the villainous Norman Osborn to involve him in a car crash. This left Flash in a near-vegetative state after waking up from a coma. Thompson returned to service and earned a Medal of Honor, although for the same mission that cost him his legs. Becoming bonded to the Venom symbiote, Flash served as Agent Venom for Project Rebirth 2.0. He struck out on his own after it was shut down and also joined the Secret Avengers.
abilities: Symbiote Prosthetic: If Flash is already missing a limb, Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom can recreate it as a symbiote prosthetic and maintain it indefinitely while possessing the symbiote and, when separating from it, losing said limb again.

Disguise: Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom can morph his external appearance to resemble another person. For this, he must pass a Charisma check of 15. Also, the symbiote can transform into any kind of non-armor clothing.
Web-Swinging: As a bonus action, Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom can move 60 ft. with his organic web swinging ability.

Regenerative Symbiote Healing: Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. His dice increases into 1d6 at level 5, then 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 15 and 1d12 at level 20. He can instantly reattach body parts after losing them or, if in battle, spend a turn for it. If he gets decapitated, he can stay alive if he succeeds on a Durability save of 25. This power is only effective while wearing the symbiote suit.
Pistols: Anti-Venom has 2 Baretta M9 as his basic equipment.

Spider-Sense Immunity: Being previously bonded to Spider-man, Agent Venom developed the ability to act without activating Spider-man's Spider-Sense, and due to the genetic memory, so can Agent Anti-Venom.

ESP: Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom possesses an extrasensory ability like a Spider-Sense, meaning he can’t be attacked by surprise. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. He doesn’t have to check perception against invisible characters.

Cloaking: Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom has the ability of merging with his surroundings, making him almost invisible. To achieve a successful cloaking, he must save to Agility. If Venom’s save is 20 or more, he can move while camouflaged and can make a Sneak Attack.

Constituent-Matter Manipulation: Agent Venom/Agent Anti-Venom can morph his body parts into all kinds of melee weapons or enlarge his fists, giving him double damage on regular melee attacks but having to save to Agility when picking up a breakable item. If failed, the item will break. This can’t be done while in battle.
Impurity Sense: Agent Anti-Venom has the can sense foreign substances within a person's body which includes diseases, drugs, toxins, parasites, radiation, poison and symbiotes.

Internal Body Cleansing: Due to Agent Anti-Venom's healing properties, he is completely immune to any kind of disease, drug, toxin, parasite, radiation, poison and any other kind of malignant substance.

Symbiote’s Killer: Agent Anti-Venom's composition is deadly to any symbiote, as even simple physical contact can damage them and even kill and assimilate them if said contact is held for a prolonged time. When assimilating symbiotes, his muscular mass increases.
Anti-Symbiote: Being the biological opposite of the symbiote species, Anti-Venom possesses absolute immunity to fire and sonic attacks.
weaknesses: Necrotic damage: Necrotic attacks do double damage against Anti-venom.

name: Black Cat
description: Felicia Hardy's father Walter Hardy was a world-renowned cat burglar who, before his arrest, encouraged her to never settle for second best. Felicia was trained in combat and decided to utilize her new skills to follow in the footsteps of her father. After having been arrested, Felicia was freed from prison by the Black Fox, her father's mentor, who took Felicia as his new pupil. After amassing a fortune in stolen items, Felicia chose to adopt a costume identity. She first donned the Black Cat costume in order to break her father out of prison. On the same night, she met Spider-Man. Despite her antipathy towards men, Felicia felt a kinship with this lone hero. Spider-Man was the first man she felt she could trust, and she grew to love him. After this, she has often used her abilities to aid Spider-Man and to work as a street level hero.
abilities: Thycokinesis: Black cat can control probability to cause bad luck to her enemies. Because of this, every enemy on a 40 ft radius gets -2 points on any kind of throw. This ability doesn’t work, when there’s another probability manipulator character near her, like Domino or Scarlet Witch.
Grappling Hook: As a bonus action, Black Cat can move 60 ft. with her grappling Hook like Spider-man does when web swinging. This can’t be done on a very open space.
Whip: Black Cat carries a whip in her basic equipment.
Expert Thief: Felicia is a skilled (somewhat reformed) thief skilled in stealth, picking locks, escapology, evading alarms and cracking safes.
Slashing Combo: Felicia always leaves her enemy bleeding when performing a full combo.
Critical Claws: When performing a critical hit, aside from the critical effect from the table, felicia leaves the enemy bleeding

name: Scarlet Spider
description: Ben Reilly is a genetic clone of Peter Parker, the super hero Spider-Man, who went on to determine his own identity as the Scarlet Spider. Ben was created by Miles Warren, the super villain known as the Jackal, to torment the hero, and seemingly died in their first encounter. The clone survived and exiled himself for five years, only returning to New York after learning that Parker's Aunt May was sick. After making amends with Peter, Ben fought alongside him as the Scarlet Spider. For a brief time, Ben and Peter were tricked by Norman Osborn via Seward Trainer to believe Ben was the real Peter Parker. Peter left New York with his wife Mary Jane Watson, leaving Ben to pick up the mantle of Spider-Man. During a subsequent confrontation against Osborn as the Green Goblin, Ben was impaled and died in Peter's arms, also discovering that Peter being the clone was a fabrication. Ben was later brought back to life by Miles Warren using a new cloning method, and spent years being constantly killed and resurrected by his creator to improve on the cloning technology. Driven mad, Ben managed to escape and overthrow Warren, becoming the new Jackal. He founded New U Technologies in an ill-conceived attempt to use cloning technology for good, but was ultimately stopped by Spider-Man. Seeking redemption but still mentally unstable, Ben moved to Las Vegas and resumed his identity as the Scarlet Spider.
abilities: Spider-Sense: Scarlet Spider can’t be attacked by surprise. He is immune to sneak attacks. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. When attacking an invisible character, Spider-man can estimate their location, so he doesn’t need a perception throw to attempt an attack. However, the attack is still thrown in disadvantage.
Web Swinging: As a bonus action, Scarlet Spider can move 60 ft. with his web swinging ability. This can’t be done on a very open space.
Lesser Healing Factor: Scarlet Spider can heal faster than an average human, allowing him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.

Radioactive Immune System: Due to his accelerated metabolism and radioactive blood, Scarlet Spider has higher tolerance for drugs and diseases than normal humans, giving him an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist diseases, drug effects and overdoses. Also, he saves in advantage when trying to resist curse diseases, such as vampirism. It’s harder for him to get drunk, but he doesn’t drink too much anyways. He throws in advantage to save from paralysis and can’t be irradiated.
weaknesses: Ethyl Chloride: Due to his spider-like physiology, Scarlet Spider is susceptible to this chemical pesticide. Spraying him directly will deal 1d8 damage and half, rounded down, his Acrobatics skill for a turn. Any incoming attack with a weapon imbued in it will have an extra d6 of damage

Web Shooter Capacity: Every time Scarlet Spider uses one of his web attacks, he uses some of his web fluid. He usually carries with 10 clips of web fluid. Each power that uses webs consumes a certain quantity of a web fluid clip. Blue powers consume 10% of the clip, green powers consume 20% of the clip, yellow powers consume 30% of the clip, red powers consume 40% of the clip and his extreme power consume 50% of the clip. Each time spider-man uses 100% of a clip, he must use an action to change the clip for a new one. When spider-man runs out of all 10 clips, he won’t be able to use his web powers until a long rest, where he produces more web fluid.

name: Ultimate Spider-Man
description: Miles Morales is a teenager from Brooklyn who was bitten by a Genetically Altered Spider and became Earth-1610's Spider-Man following the death of that reality's Peter Parker. After the Multiverse was destroyed and subsequently rebuilt, Miles Morales, along with his friends and family, were transported to Earth-616 and rewritten into that world's history.
abilities: Spider-Sense: Spider-man can’t be attacked by surprise. He is immune to sneak attacks. For every first attack against him, he can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. When attacking an invisible character, Spider-man can estimate their location, so he doesn’t need a perception throw to attempt an attack. However, the attack is still thrown in disadvantage.
Lesser Healing Factor: Spider-man can heal faster than an average human. This allows him to heal 1d4 every turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Web Swinging: As a bonus action, Spider-man can move 60 ft. with his web swinging ability. This can’t be done on a very open space.

Radioactive Immune System: Due to his accelerated metabolism and radioactive blood, Spider-Man has higher tolerance for drugs and diseases than normal humans, giving him an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist diseases, drug effects and overdoses. Also, he saves in advantage when trying to resist curse diseases, such as vampirism. It’s harder for him to get drunk, but he doesn’t drink too much anyways. He throws in advantage to save from poisoning, irradiation, and paralysis.
Bilingual: Miles can talk both English and Spanish fluently.
weaknesses: Ethyl Chloride: Due to his spider-like physiology, Spider-Man is susceptible to this chemical pesticide. Spraying him directly will deal 1d8 damage and half, rounded down, his Acrobatics skill for a turn. Any incoming attack with a weapon imbued in it will have an extra d6 of damage

Web Shooter Capacity: Every time Spider-Man uses one of his web attacks, he uses some of his web fluid. He usually carries with 10 clips of web fluid. Each power that uses webs consumes a certain quantity of a web fluid clip. Blue powers consume 10% of the clip, green powers consume 20% of the clip, yellow powers consume 30% of the clip, red powers consume 40% of the clip and his extreme power consume 50% of the clip. Each time spider-man uses 100% of a clip, he must use an action to change the clip for a new one. When spider-man runs out of all 10 clips, he won’t be able to use his web powers until a long rest, where he produces more web fluid.

name: Ghost-Spider
description: After being bitten by a genetically-engineered spider, Gwen was granted arachnid-like super-powers, and started a career as a crimefighter, dubbed by the media as “Spider-Woman“. She was given a costume and a set of web-shooters by retired crimefighter Janet van Dyne. Gwen spent most of her early adventures focused on exploiting and maintaining her newfound attention more than helping those in need; however, Gwen's behavior changed after her father expressed he believed Spider-Woman could easily help people.Spider-Woman's influence also caused one of the biggest tragedies in Gwen's life. The bullied Peter Parker, desperate to be special like his idol Spider-Woman, conducted an experiment that turned him into a Lizard-like creature. Parker crashed the Midtown Senior Prom, where Gwen fought him. Despite his pleas for de-escalation, Gwen did not pull any punches. Following Gwen’s beatdown, Peter returned to his human form but, due to the injuries sustained at Gwen's attacks, he died. With no evidence or link to his transformation, Spider-Woman was blamed by the media for Peter's death and branded a criminal. Haunted by Peter's death, Gwen doubled her efforts to fight crime to redeem herself. Additionally, Gwen's father George was tasked with conducting the NYPD investigation to capture Spider-Woman. When Miles Morales' father vanished from Earth-616 and was found on Earth-65, Gwen teamed up with him and discovered that Jefferson Davis' Earth-65 counterpart was S.I.L.K. field agent known as the Scorpion. Coming across an alternate future world where they were married and had children, Gwen and Miles formed a romantic connection but were forced to part ways. She was eventually vanished from her universe, and now operates on the main Marvel Universe, under the alias of Ghost-Spider, with the hope of one day returning to her own universe
abilities: Spider-Sense: Ghost Spider can’t be attacked by surprise. She is immune to sneak attacks. For every first attack against her, she can save to agility to evade the upcoming attack. When attacking an invisible character, Gwen can estimate their location, so she doesn’t need a perception throw to attempt an attack. However, the attack is still thrown in disadvantage.
Web Swinging: As a bonus action, Gwen can move 60 ft. with her web swinging ability. This can’t be done on a very open space.

Radioactive Immune System: Due to his accelerated metabolism and radioactive blood, Ghost Spider has higher tolerance for drugs and diseases than normal humans, giving her an extra d6 in every Durability check when trying to resist diseases, drug effects and overdoses. Also, she saves in advantage when trying to resist curse diseases, such as vampirism. It’s harder for her to get drunk, but she doesn’t drink too much anyways. She throws in advantage to save from poisoning, irradiation, and paralysis.
Musician: Gwen plays the drums with her band, The Mary Janes.
Skilled Detective: Gwen has a proclivity for analytical thinking and detective work. She is also the daughter of a police captain, thus she knows some police protocols and methods.

Ticket to the Multiverse: With the help of her Earth-3109 counterpart, Gwen can travel between dimensions with a pendant that is essentially a modified Dimensional Travel Watch that's specifically keyed to her body's unique radiation signature. It can also be worn as a bracelet.

name: Spider-Woman
description: Agent of Hydra. Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent of S.W.O.R.D. Bounty hunter. Private eye. Super powered. De-powered. Jessica Drew has been all of these things, but it seems no matter where her life takes her, it is her destiny to be the high-flying Super Hero known to the world as Spider-Woman.Young Jessica Drew’s powers began as a desperate father’s attempt to save his ailing daughter. Poisoned in the early 20th century by the uranium that was common in her childhood home in Transia, her father sought a... let’s call it unorthodox remedy. Johnathan Drew, an expert in the regenerative properties of certain arachnids, injected his daughter with an experimental serum and placed her in a genetic accelerator, where she remained for decades. When she emerged, she had unusual powers and eventually took on the identity of Spider-Woman. Under this moniker Drew has been a spy, a private detective, a double-agent of both S.H.I.E.L.D and Hydra, an Avenger, and a superhero serving countless organizations. She's quick, she’s multitalented, and she brings an amazing package of abilities to the tabletop for her 4 Threat. Spider-Woman makes fantastic use of all the bio-electric abilities that turn-of-the-century genetic engineering can provide!
abilities: Spider Pheromones: Spider-Woman can use her pheromones to persuade or convince people. This action will give a +3 bonus on every deception, charisma, persuasion, or convincing type of action.
Can’t Touch This: Spider-Woman is immune to charm status effects.
Lesser Healing Factor: Spider-Woman can heal faster than an average human, this allows her to heal 1d4 every turn. Her dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.

Glide: Spider-Woman cannot fly, she can glide, which mean she cannot self-propel to get height. However, her flight skill indicates at which speed she can move when gliding. This skill can also be used to stop fall damage.
Master Martial Artist: As a master of various martial arts, Spider-Woman has proficiency in Melee.
Multilingual: Due to her espionage training, she is fluent in Russian, Japanese, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Korean and German.

name: She-Hulk
description: Jennifer Walters is a talented lawyer and the cousin of Bruce Banner, the Hulk. After being shot by a mobster and seriously injured, she was saved by a blood transfusion from Bruce, and his gamma-irradiated blood mutated Jennifer into the She-Hulk, kicking off her adventuring career. Jen wasn't as strong as her cousin, but she maintained her intelligence as She-Hulk, soon learning to control her transformations and even embracing her green form. Throughout the years, Jen fought for justice in court and on the streets, developing great rivalries and friendships, and growing to become a respected leader. She worked for the District Attorney and also fought crime as a member of countless teams, namely the world-famous Avengers and Fantastic Four.
abilities: She-Hulk Jump: As a bonus action, She-Hulk can jump 60 ft horizontally in battle.
Foreign Chemical Resistant: She-Hulk is resistant to radioactive or poison damage attacks, and she is immune to being poisoned or irradiated.
Disease Immunity: She-Hulk’s irradiated cells make her completely immune to any disease on Earth.
Stunning Combo:  If She-Hulk deals a full successful combo on a character, she leaves her victim stunned.

Regenerative Healing Factor: She-Hulk has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows her to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. Her dice increases into 1d6 at level 5, then 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 15 and 1d12 at level 20. Additionally, she can regenerate body parts after losing them. If she is in possession of her lost limb, she can re-attach it and fixing time will be 1d10 minutes or, if in battle, 1d4 turns. If the limb is lost, she must wait an amount of 2d12 hours for it to fully grow again and, in the case of a hand or arm, a third of that time to partially grow and being able only to hold small objects. If she gets decapitated, she can stay alive if she succeeds on a Durability check of 25 and someone else must help him to reattach her head to her body. If in battle, the one helping her will spend an entire turn just helping her. If her head is lost, she can regrow it if she succeeds a Durability save of 27 and it will take her 3d12 hours to fully recover. If fallen, she just needs two successes to wake up.
Master Attorney: When using deception or persuasion, She-Hulk can use an extra d4 to convince other characters.
Medium Awareness: She-Hulk is sometimes aware that she is a fictional character. She can attempt to directly interact with the GM once per long rest, but she need to achieve a luck check of 15.

name: Moon Knight
description: Marc Spector, better known as the vigilante Moon Knight, was once a mercenary left for dead in the desert, where he was revived by the Moon god Khonshu. Appointed as Khonshu's fist and high priest, Moon Knight enacts justice to protect those who travel at night. Marc also has dissociative identity disorder, some of his alters being millionaire Steven Grant and cab driver Jake Lockley. In the beginning of his career, Marc fought crime on the streets with the help of a network of informants, including his best friend “Frenchie“ Duchamp, the homeless Bertrand Crawley, and diner owner Gena Landers. Since the early days, Marc has mostly worked alone, but he's also been a member of a few superhero teams, including the West Coast Avengers, the Secret Avengers, and the Heroes for Hire.
abilities: Multilingual: In addition to English, Spector is fluent in Symkarian, Arabic and has demonstrated his proficiency in both the Egyptian and Sudanese dialects of it.
Pain Resistance: Moon Knight has an incredibly strong threshold for pain. This allows him to reduce the damage of an attack in 1d20 once per battle.
Expert Detective: Spector is a good private investigator, when investigating he gets a 1d4 bonus on his checks.
Glide: Moon knight can slowly fall from high distance, and glide up to 90 ft. He can also use his cape to nullify fall damage by succeeding an agility check of 10.
Interrogation Expert: When attempting a throw while interrogating, he can have a bonus of 1d6.
Telepathic Resistance: Spector’s multiple personalities give him immunity to telepathic control or possession.
Weapon equipment: Moon Knight has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. Including a Truncheon, a Staff, 1 Flash Grenade, 3 Daggers and a Boomerang
Khonshu’s Golden Ankh: Moon Knight carries Khonshu’s Golden Ankh which glows when someone’s life is in great dange near him.
weaknesses: Brain damage/mental illness: While it was initially believed Marc suffered from dissociative identity disorder, it was determined that the different personas he has developed throughout his life are a consequence of having become Khonshu's avatar. He has other 3 personalities, known as Steven Grant and Jake Lockley, which give him different skillsets.

name: Namor
description: King Namor McKenzie, a.k.a. the Sub-Mariner, is the current ruler of Atlantis. Born as a mutant-hybrid son of a human father and an Atlantean princess, Namor has pale skin, unlike his Atlantean brethren (who usually have blue skin). To the surface dwellers, he is sometimes their ally, sometimes their enemy, for Namor's true allegiance is to Atlantis and its people.
abilities: Aquatic Healing Factor: Namor has a powerful regenerative healing factor that allows him to heal 1d4 each turn on level 1. Each two level up, the dice gets bigger until it reaches d12 at level 10. Then, an extra d4 is gained and the process repeats until level 19 is reached, where it gets 2d12. However, Namor's accelerated healing only works while he is immersed in water, it diminishes once he is out of contact with water or if he is completely dry.
Underwater Super Hearing: While underwater Namor can hear clearly up to 120 ft away.

Underwater Breathing: Like all Atlanteans, Namor can breathe indefinitely underwater due to having gills located behind his ears. Unlike most Atlanteans, however, Namor can also breathe on land indefinitely as well, without the aid of breathing devices, whereas most Atlanteans can only survive being out of the water for a matter of minutes. He can also survive normally to high amounts of water pressure without the aid of gadgets.
Radiation Absorption: Namor can absorb certain levels of radiation. He is immune to being irradiated and all radiation damage on him is cut in half.

Diplomatic Immunity: As the leader of a sovereign nation, he often visits the United States or the United Nations for political reasons. He employs diplomatic immunity during these trips. He can’t go to jail.

Aquatic Telepathy: Namor possesses a telepathic rapport with all forms of marine life. He can mentally communicate with most forms of marine life and can mentally persuade them to do his bidding. Namor can also mentally communicate with other Atlanteans (giving mental/telepathic orders to all his men).
Amazing Multilingual: Namor speaks every language on earth.
weaknesses: Water Deficiency: When not exposed to water, many of Namor’s physical attributes gradually decline and can reach a point where he possesses only a small fraction of his powers. Namor's strength, Durability, and defense are reduced by 2 points for every in-game day Namor doesn’t immerse in water or under very dry enviroments like deserts.

Bipolar Tendencies: Namor is believed to be during an imbalance during the times in which he becomes angry very easily, which he is well known for, and is unable to think clearly and logically. After very stressful situations, the game master can ask Namor to do a Wisdom check. If failed, Namor will become Bipolar, which will make him hostile with his allies until he gets a long rest.

name: The Original Human Torch
description: The Human Torch was an android created by Professor Phineas T. Horton for scientific purposes. At a press-conference unveiling, however, Horton's creation burst into flames when exposed to oxygen, and, with human-like sentience, personality, and awareness, rebelled against his creator. Public outcry led to the Torch's being sealed in concrete, which Horton did until he could find a way to control the android's flames, though he eventually escaped due to a crack that let oxygen seep in. While the Torch then inadvertently caused parts of New York City to burn, he eventually learned to control his flame and vowed to help humanity. He would join other heroes like Captain America, Namor and the other Invaders, as war broke out in Europe, and later in the Pacific, to fight the Axis powers. During this time he acquired a young partner, Thomas “Toro“ Raymond and battles by his side for years.
abilities: Flight: The Human Torch's plasma has a high hydrogen content and is surrounded by an exuded cloud of mono-atomic hydrogen atoms. The hot cloud provides sufficient positive buoyancy for him to float. With mental stimulation of his flame, he can provide enough lift to carry around 180 pounds. By forming a jet from his feet, directed behind him, he can achieve a normal flight speed of 50 ft per turn.

Immunity to Fire & Heat: The Human Torch is unaffected by heat and flames, including his own, even when part of him is aflame and the rest of him is not. His flesh cannot be scalded or burned by any heat source whose level is below that of his maximum output.

Plasma Form: As a bonus action, The Human Torch can turn into plasma. In this state, his body is no longer solid, firearm damage is reduced in half and every successful physical attack against him will deal 1d8 fire damage to the attacker. He can also deactivate plasma mode as a bonus action. Plasma mode’s duration depends on Jim’s health. If he has less than 30% of his health, his flame form will wear off in the next 2 turns, and he will have to wait for 3 turns to be able to turn into plasma again. While in this form, his normal attacks deal fire damage and if he deals a successful combo against another character, he will leave them burned.
Burning Combo: The human torch leaves the enemy burned when achieving a full combo
weaknesses: Energy Depletion: At an average rate of expenditure of energy, the Torch can maintain his plasma state for about 16.8 hours before he is forced to revert to his solid state.

Fire Extinguishing: The Human Torch's flame is supported by the presence of oxygen, and thus is extinguished in low air pressure or a vacuum. Thus, he can’t use his plasma mode in outer space. The Torch's flame can be extinguished by smothering materials, such as water, sand, fire-fighting foam, and heat-resistant blankets, unless his flame is at such an intensity that it immediately vaporizes such materials on contact. If a character tries to use any of these materials to extinguish his fire, he can attempt a Thermokinesis throw of 14 to maintain his plasma mode on. If hit with small amounts of water, up to about five gallons, the Torch can turn it to steam with relatively little effort. More water than that could extinguish his flame at its normal level, and he would have to wait until he could evaporate the residual moisture before re-ignition. He can’t turn into the torch underwater.

name: Agent Carter
description: By 1943, Peggy had joined the French Resistance as a field agent, codenamed Agent 13. While working undercover in a café during a very rainy day, she met a young soldier named Steve Rogers. The two shared what she believed to be a brief romance, though Rogers (in his role as Captain America) would walk in on Peggy after she'd killed a roomful of Nazi soldiers, and the two struck up a long-term romance. Unbeknownst to Cap, Peggy had been instructed by the Daughters of Liberty to get close to him in order to monitor him and keep him out of the wrong hands, though her love for him was genuine. Peggy would also join the original five Invaders in battle. Unfortunately, Peggy and Cap parted ways when they were each given missions by their respective superiors. She remained in contact with Cap up until his disappearance later that year. Peggy went old and died many years later. When the sentient Cosmic Cube known as Kobik replaced Captain America with an alternate reality counterpart of himself, she also inadvertently revived and rejuvenated Peggy. Now she works under the codename of The Dryad, working alongside her niece Sharon.
abilities: Communications Training: During her long tenures with S.H.I.E.L.D. and other intelligence agencies, Peggy became a highly trained communications officer, a training that would serve her well in her tenure with the Avengers.
