Weapon equipment: Agent Carter has special weapon equipment that she gets at the beginning of his missions. Incluiding a Beretta M9, 1 Flash Grenade, a Dagger and 3 First Aid Kit
Toxicology: Having become a trained medical doctor, Peggy was also a skilled toxicologist, being able to study Mindstorm's custom poison and crafting an antidote within an hour's time.

name: Giant-Man
description: Hank Pym, Ph.D, was an American entomologist, biochemist, roboticist, engineer and physicist and “Scientific Adventurer“. He was considered one of the smartest humans on Earth. He discovered the Pym Particles, subatomic particles which can increase or decrease the size and mass of objects or living beings. He built a suit and for a time, became the original Ant-Man, fighting beside his future wife, Janet Van Dyne, who had taken on the mantle of the Wasp. Alongside Van Dyne, he became a founding member of the Avengers, “Earth's Mightiest Heroes“. Pym was the creator of the deadly android, Ultron. He was also able to modify his Pym Particles to allow him to grow in size to become Giant-Man, and later Goliath. After a nervous breakdown he changed identities to Yellowjacket. His skills in science also led him to be appointed Earth's Scientist Supreme.
abilities: Insect Communication and Control: Using his Cybernetic Helmet, Hank could communicate with and control certain higher insects.

Super-Genius Intelligence: Dr. Henry Pym is one of the world's foremost biochemists and also possesses considerable expertise in numerous scientific fields such as subatomic physics, robotics, cybernetics, artificial intelligence, programming, emergency medicine, optics and entomology.
Skilled Combatant: Hank is a skilled hand-to-hand combatant using special styles of unarmed combat depending on his size.
weaknesses: Mental Difficulties: Henry Pym suffered a series of mental breakdowns over the years. He was eventually identified as suffering from a bipolar disorder. At the beginning of a day, Hank must save to 8 wisdom, if failed, he will be depressive, which reduces her perception and charisma to 0. If she gets less than 4 in the check, he will become maniac, which may make him act hostile towards her allies.

name: Unstoppable Wasp
description: Nadia was the daughter of Hank Pym and his first wife, Maria Trovaya, who was kidnapped during their honeymoon and subsequently killed by foreign agents. Nadia was raised in the Red Room in Moscow, Russia, where she was trained to become a Red Room agent herself. After studying the Pym Particles enough to master their size-changing properties, Nadia used them escape the Red Room. After her escape, Nadia immediately made her way to the front door of Hank Pym's home in Cresskill, New Jersey, where she discovered that Hank had seemingly sacrificed his life to stop Ultron shortly beforehand. Crushed that her father passed before she could even meet him, Nadia decided to shrink down and break into his lab in order to learn as much about him as she could. Using old Ant-Man suit pieces and materials lying around, she crafted a new costume and decided to become the new Wasp, vowing to earn the admiration of her father's allies.
abilities: Graceful Dancer: Nadia was taught various types of dances in the Red Room.
Tactician: Nadia is a very effective strategist and tactician, capable of devising a plan to easily overpower multiple assailants with low effort.
Multilingual: Nadia can speak fluent English, Russian, Spanish, French, Italian, Japanese, and Mandarin Chinese.

Genetic Size manipulation: Because of the Pym Particles in her bloodstream, Nadia could reduce herself in size, usually down to a few inches, at which size she is not easy to notice. though she has no issue shrinking further. In addition to being able to shrink, Nadia can grow as well. All this, without need of a suit.

Genius Intelligence: Nadia has a great aptitude for science. Her handlers at the Red Room, believing her skills to be genetic, informed her of her famous heritage and began encouraging her to emphasize more on her studies.
weaknesses: Mental Difficulties: Nadia suffers from Bipolar Disorder, signified by Manic episodes of incredible highs followed by near-or-at suicidal lows. At the beginning of a day, Nadia must save to 8 wisdom, if failed, she will be depressive, which reduces her perception and charisma to 0. If she gets less than 4 in the check, she will become maniac, which will make her act hostile towards her allies.

name: Black Knight
description: The title of the Black Knight is a title that has been passed around throughout the centuries to the current wielder of the magical Ebony Blade. The first man to take on the Black Knight name was Sir Percy of Scandia. In more modern times, the Black Knight is the hero and Avengers member Dane Whitman.Dane inherited his uncle Nathan Garrett's castle. He was unaware that his uncle had been the villainous Black Knight until finding notes and inventions. Eventually he came upon the Ebony Blade. Passing its test, Sir Percival explained the history of the blade and its curse. Taking the weapon Dane decided to be a hero, joining the Masters of Evil just as his uncle did, but with the intent of infiltrating them from within. This he did to aid the Avengers, but they did not trust him until he later assisted them against Kang the Conqueror.
abilities: Ebony Blade: Dane Whitman carries the Ebony Blade as his basic equipment. The blade is linked to him, granting him great powers. When the wierlder is separated from his blade, he can either teleport to its location or summon it telekinetically, similar to Thor’s Mjolnir. The ebony blade is immune to magic, so it cannot be enchanted or cursed. However, the user can still be damaged by magic attacks.

Ebony Enchantment: When Dane Whitman is killed, the ebony blade can resurrect him with a magic check of 12. However, every time he is resurrected his wisdom is reduced in 1 point. If his wisdom goes down to 0, he will become hostile and will no longer be playable
Psychic Resistance: The ebony blade gives Dane resistance to psychic abilities. Any attempt to control his mind is thrown in disadvantage and psychic attacks deal half damage.
Expert Horseman: He is also an expert horseman.

Gifted Scientist: Whitman started out as a scientist, though specializing in physics (having earned a Master's degree in physics), he is proficient in a wide array of advanced sciences and technologies, including genetic and mechanical engineering; and continues to approach things from a scientific perspective more often than not, despite his ties to the world of magic.
Skilled Tactician & Strategist: He has also demonstrated good leadership skills as leader of both the Avengers and UltraForce. He has strong strategic and tactical skills.
weaknesses: Ebony Curse: The user of the ebony blade is always tempted by the dark powers of the sword. Every time Dane commits an act that is morally ambiguous or ethically incorrect, the GM can ask him to make a wisdom check. If failed, Dane gains 1 dark point. These dark points can only be reduced in 1 by performing a very noble act if determined by the GM and do not reset. However, if Dane gains 4 dark points, he will no longer be playable and will become a boss, fighting the rest of the party to steal their souls by killing them with the Ebony Blade. This boss battle will start with Dane using the Darkness Unleashed power.

name: Union Jack
description: Joey Chapman was the working class son of a Manchester dock worker who showed a talent for art. He was ashamed of his father when he was young because he believed he didn't do enough to raise his station in life, but once Chapman became an adult he came to respect how hardworking his father had been.[5] He went to university to study art and it was there that he met Kenneth Crichton who he was also on the wrestling team with. Kenneth was the son of Lord and Lady Crichton and the grandson of Lord Falsworth. Despite coming from different worlds the two struck up a close friendship. It was during a visit to Kenneth's ancestral home Falsworth manor that he was told the family secret: Both Kenny's grandfather and late uncle had worn the heroic mantle of Union Jack, while Ken's mother had been the superheroine Spitfire; also that the black sheep of the family Lord Falsworth's brother had been the vampiric German agent Baron Blood. Also visiting the Manor was family friend Steve Rogers who was summoned by Montgomery to help investigate the return of Baron Blood.They didn't have to wait long for the Baron soon entered the manor disguised as the local doctor, intending to turn his wheelchair-bound brother into one of the undead, condemning Montgomery to an eternity as a crippled old man. Lord Falsworth intended to act as bait by luring his brother into a trap, but he suffered a heart attack and was too weak to carry it out. It was decided that Joey would take Kenneth's place as Union Jack, as Kenneth would not have been strong enough to survive the fight.When the Baron was left alone with whom he thought to be his brother, he moved in for the kill; but then Chapman exploded out of the bed and launched a surprise attack against the vampire. Captain America entered the fray shortly afterward, and even though Chapman's inexperience in fighting vampires would work against him, the two valiantly fought Blood, and the Baron was eventually decapitated by Captain America's shield. Recognizing how he had earned it, the Falsworth's decided to allow Joey to continue as the new Union Jack. Shortly afterward Lord Falsworth passed away safe in the knowledge his legacy would live on.
abilities: Weapons Master: Union Jack is a master of many different weapons.
Master Spy: Union Jack is an expert in the field of espionage. He is skilled in stealth, demolitions, survival, deducing other persons ways of thinking and other fields.
Weapon equipment: Union Jack has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. Including a Webley .455 Caliber Pistol, 2 Flash Grenade and a Dagger

name: Dum Dum Dugan
description: In early 1941, Dugan was traveling with the circus through Europe. In the Netherlands, Dugan first met Nick Fury, the man who would become his closest friend, who was then a performer in a stunt flying act and parachute instructor. Dugan helped Fury and Sam Sawyer escape the Nazis during a mission. Dugan later joined the British Army. When Sawyer was charged with creating Fury's First Attack Squad, also known as the Howling Commandos, Sawyer invited Dugan to become second in command. The broken Great Wheel led to the creation of S.H.I.E.L.D., Hydra, Leviathan, and the Zodiac Cartel. Due to their long history together, Nick Fury invited Dugan to join S.H.I.E.L.D. In August of 1966, a year after the establishment of S.H.I.E.L.D. Dugan was fattally wounded by a ricocheted bullet. Deeply affected by the prospect of losing his best friend, Fury decided to put to work some extremely advanced Life-Model Decoys which had been retrofitted with alien tech. As an LMD, Dugan served at the front lines of many of S.H.I.E.L.D.'s battles. Dugan also came to know and befriend many of the world's heroes, including the Fantastic Four, Iron Man, Falcon, Black Widow, Quasar, and of course Captain America.
abilities: Weapons Master: Dum Dum Dugan is a master of many different weapons.
Life Model Decoy: Since he has a cybernetic body, he is immune to diseases, poisoning, charming, telepathic control, or purple control.
Weapon equipment: Dum Dum Dugan has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. Including a Winchester Model 1912, 2 Incendiary Grenades and a Dagger
weaknesses: Hacking: Dum Dum Dugan’s body is vulnerable to being controlled by hacking. John Garrett once had S.H.I.E.L.D. scientists alter the signal sent to Dugan's body containing his consciousness to block his decision-making abilities and turn him into a puppet.

name: Star Lord
description: Leader of the Guardians of the Galaxy, Peter Quill, brings a sassy sense of humor while protecting the universe from any and all threats. Peter Quill always longed to adventure across the universe. After joining NASA and encountering a celestial being on one of his first trips to space, Quill chose to venture out on his own as the intergalactic Super Hero known as Star-Lord. Star-Lord founded the second iteration of the Guardians, recruiting the likes of Groot, Rocket Raccoon, Gamora, Drax the Destroyer, Quasar, and Adam Warlock into his super crew.
abilities: Translator implant: Peter has a translator implant on his neck allowing him to understand various alien languages, along with English, Spanish, Russian, German and. Mandarin
Lesser healing Factor: Star lord can heal himself in 1d4 each turn turns. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Living Power Plant; Star Lord can recharge any object which has run out of energy, He can recharge 1 power point each 5 turns.
Flying Boots: As a bonus action, Star Lord can use his boots to fly 20 ft vertically per turn or 30 ft horizontally.
Semi-Immortality: Spartax may have life spans that are somewhat longer than those of normal humans from Earth.
Equipment: Star Lord uses his elemental guns and two gravimetric grenades.
Oxygen Supply: Peter’s Helmet has an atmospheric re-breather system that lets Quill survive the vacuum of space unaided.
Pressure Support: The helmet protects the wearer's face from sudden changes in air pressure.
Telepathic Resistance: Any psychic or Telepathic attack attempted against Star Lord is thrown in disadvantage.
weaknesses: Elemental Guns: All his powers use the elemental guns to channel his energy. If he lost both, he can no longer use them. If he loses one of them, his powers deal half damage. However, if his gun falls, he can recall it to his hands as a bonus action in his turn.

name: Gamora
description: Gamora is a deadly assassin, raised by Thanos the Mad Titan to become the most dangerous woman in the galaxy. She is the sole survivor of the Zen-Whoberis, who were exterminated by the Universal Church of Truth, worshippers of the Magus. Taken by Thanos to the past, she was forged from victim into the killer of the Magus. Under Thanos' care, Gamora was trained as an elite assassin and had her body mechanically improved. Gamora's mission eventually led her to meet Adam Warlock, the Magus' younger self. As a temporal anomaly, Gamora's help was crucial for Warlock and Thanos to defeat the Magus. With the Magus defeated, events in the future changed so that her people were slaughtered by the Badoon instead, and Gamora's memories of those events have been affected by these timeline changes. Gamora questioned her father's macabre obsession with death and ultimately betrayed him, joining Warlock and eventually Star-Lord and his Guardians of the Galaxy.
abilities: Multilingual: Gamora can speak English and many different alien languages.
Lesser healing Factor: Gamora can heal herself in 1d4 each turn. Her dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Weapon equipment: Gamora has special weapon equipment that she gets at the beginning of her missions. Including a Katana, an Energy blaster and 2 Flash Grenades

Master Tactician and Strategist: She is an accomplished strategist. She had been widely considered one of, if not the greatest, both on and off the battlefield. She is able to formulate battle strategies and her brilliant tactical sense allows her to alter any strategy to fit the changing need of the situation.

Master Assassin: Gamora is an extremely skilled assassin, being sent by Thanos to kill many of his adversaries across the galaxy. She also is a master with nerve strikes she even knows a nerve strike that will kill anyone besides thanos.

Master Martial Artist: She knows 83.4% of fighting styles in the Universe. She also one of the most skilled martial artists in the universe. She is capable of defeating opponents who possess superhuman strength and durability that far surpass her own, and she has defeated a military platoon containing dozens of combat-trained men in only a few minutes. She has learned to paralyze or kill opponents using vital point strikes directed at certain nerve clusters.
Paralyzing Combo: Gamora leaves the enemy paralyzed when achieving a full combo.

name: Rocket Raccoon
description: Rocket Raccoon is a genetically and cybernetically enhanced raccoon turned freelance mercenary turned member of the Guardians of the Galaxy. He is considered to have one of the best tactical minds in the galaxy. He hails from Halfworld in the Keystone Quadrant where scientists were able to turn animals into sentient beings. Alongside his friend and partner Groot, he travels the galaxy picking up bounties.
abilities: Multilingual: Rocket can speak English and many different alien languages, including flora colossus language.
Raccoon Sense: Rocket can detect every enemy in battle, even if they’re invisible or hidden. He has 50% chance of noticing a surprise opportunity attack.
Weapon equipment: Rocket has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. Including an Energy blaster, a Heavy Energy Blaster, 2 Flash Grenades and 2 Energy Grenades

Accomplished Tactician and Strategist: He is an instinctive tactical genius, though relatively inexperienced in that field. He is able to formulate battle strategies with his brilliant tactical sense and allows him to alter many strategies to fit the changing need of the situation.
Pilot: Rocket is an accomplished starship pilot.
Slashing Combo: Rocket leaves the enemy bleeding when achieving a full combo.

name: Groot
description: Groot was a Flora colossi from Planet X, the capital of the branch worlds. He did not get along with his fellow saplings, instead preferring the company of the Maintenance Mammals who the other saplings treated with prejudice. Into his adulthood, Groot found himself in Kree space, where he was promptly captured and imprisoned. While in jail, he formed a rapport with Rocket Raccoon and was assigned to a covert ops team led by Star-lord. Groot joined Star-Lord's Guardians of the Galaxy, alongside many of those he had fought against the Phalanx alongside, including Rocket, who is now his best friend.
abilities: Lesser healing Factor: Groot can heal himself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Healing Aura: Every turn any ally is close in 5 ft, it gets healed in 5 hp.
weaknesses: Language Barrier: To most people, Groot appears to only say “I am Groot.“ This made communication with most people all but completely futile. Only people who speak Flora Colossus, can communicate with him. However, telepaths can read his mind and understand his thoughts.

name: Drax the Destroyer
description: Born Arthur Douglas, Drax was just a normal family man who lived with his wife and daughter, who would go on to become Moondragon, until Thanos came to Earth and slaughtered his family. After the death of his family, Arthur swore revenge on the man who killed his wife and separated him from his daughter, becoming Drax the Destroyer. Drax the Destroyer would later join the Guardians of the Galaxy and become a prominent member of the team.
abilities: Multilingual: Drax can speak English and many different alien languages.
Thanos Tracking: Drax has a small cosmic awareness that allows him to track Thanos.
Lesser healing Factor: Drax can heal himself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Weapon equipment: Drax uses 2 knives as his basic equipment, he uses them double handed.
Saxophonist: Drax can play the Saxophone.
weaknesses: Obsession: Drax was created to destroy Thanos the Mad Titan and as such he has somewhat all-consuming focus on killing his greatest enemy. If any characters gets in his way to kill Thanos, he will fight them, even if its an ally.

name: Mantis
description: Mantis was the daughter of Gustav Brandt and Lua Nguyen. While a child, she was trained by the alien Priests of Pama, a sect of the Kree, who believed that she might become the Celestial Madonna. She excelled in her martial arts studies, which landed her the name Mantis. Being the protectors of the Cotati, the Priests of Pama enhanced her mind giving her telepathic abilities. She met the Swordsman in Vietnam. She helped him regain his self-respect and followed him when the former villain attempted to rejoin the Avengers. As an Avenger, Mantis battled the Troglodytes, and then later Doctor Strange as part of the Avengers/Defenders War. She eventually agreed to help Quill in forming the Guardians of the Galaxy by psychically influencing Drax, Phyla-Vell, Gamora, and a newly resurrected Adam Warlock to join their struggling attempts to reestablish the galaxy's balance and order after the destruction from the Annihilation waves.
abilities: Multilingual: Mantis can speak English and many different alien languages. She can use her empathy to communicate with cotati.
Precognition: While sleeping, the master can reveal to her future events.

Mind Link: Mantis can communicate telepathically with any other characters on a 180 ft. Radius. She can make a link with allies which allows him to communicate with them anywhere in the same dimension if they are not telepathically cloaking.
Fatal Blow Durability: Mantis only needs 2 checks to avoid dying when falling in battle. Once per battle, when receiving a final blow, she won’t fall and will keep 1 hp.

name: Yondu
description: Yondu Udonta is a Centaurian born in a tribe on the primitive planet of Centauri-IV. At a very young age, Yondu presenced the coming of an alien species to his tribe, the Syneca. Yondu was excommunicated from the tribe before he could learn how to whistle, a well-known ability of the Centaurians which allows them to control the Yaka arrows. After years in a life outlaw activities, Yondu became the leader of the Ravagers, a group of space pirates. Yondu found a young Peter Quill when a Kree Warbird he was interested in malfunctioned in Quill's hands, leaving him stranded in outer space. Yondu and Peter grew closer over time, and after having relegated him to janitor duties, he decided to promote Quill to being a Ravager as he saw some potential in Quill's abilities as a pirate. But Quill escaped and abandoned them. He would eventully find him with his new crew, the Guardians of the Galaxy.
abilities: Multilingual: Yondu can speak English and many different alien languages.
Weapon equipment: Yondu has special weapon equipment that he gets at the beginning of his missions. Including an Energy blaster, a Knife and 2 Energy Grenades
Leadership: Yondu has led an unruly group of criminals for decades, through strength of will, guile, and deadly force.
Pilot: Aside from commanding a colossal carrier ship, Yondu's skills as a pilot allow him to effectively pilot armed scout ships into combat.
weaknesses: Yaka Arrow cerebral Implant: Yondu’s main weapon is the Yaka Arrow, which he controls psionically through a cerebral implant. If his cerebral implant is removed from his head, he won’t be able to control his arrow anymore.

name: Nova
description: Richard Rider was born in Hempstead, New York. As a teenager, he was chosen at random by the alien Rhomann Dey, last surviving Centurion of the planet Xandar's elite Nova Corps, to inherit his power and succeed him in the rank of Nova Prime following the destruction of his world by the intergalactic pirate Zorr. The sudden infusion of power overloaded Rider's body, and he was hospitalized. While Rider was comatose, the moribund Rhomann Dey explained to him telepathically what had happened to him and what his mission was. Rider's recovery was as sudden as his incapacitation had been, being preceded by eye-blasts that knocked a doctor out of his room. Discharged, he tried to resume his normal routine. But the very next day, Rider was alone in his bedroom when Dey suddenly transmitted to him Dey's last gift to Rider, his Centurion's uniform. Rider discovered that he now possessed super strength, near invulnerability, the power to fly, and a uniform with a sealed life-support system, but with little instruction as to how to use these new powers. Indeed, he barely had the opportunity to test out these powers before radio circuitry contained in his uniform's helmet alerted him to Zorr, who was on a rampage in the heart of New York City. Rider was able to locate Zorr and engage him in combats, although he was unable to fatally wound Zorr. Now he is Nova, a super-hero that protects not only earth but the entire galaxy.
abilities: Xandarian Worldmind Translator: The Xandarian Worldmind Auto-translates languages around Rider, allowing him to speak, read and understand any language that the Xandarian Worldmind is familiar with.
Xandarian Worldmind psi Shield: The Xandarian Worldmind gives Nova resistance to psychic attacks and immunity to psychic or telepathy control.
Worldmind control: The worldmind controls nova when he is asleep, which allows him to do combat actions, even when sleeping.
Lesser healing Factor: Nova can heal himself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
weaknesses: Worldmind Dependance: Nova uses the Xandarian Worldmind to help maintain his mood and mental stability. Without it, utilizing the full power of the Nova Force would overcome Rider's mental stability, causing a severe mental breakdown and possibly insanity. Rider was also bonded with so much of the Nova force for so long that the molecular structure of his body cannot survive for more than two days without it or an appropriate substitute, like Quasar's quantum energy.

name: Ms. Marvel
description: Kamala Khan, a.k.a. Ms. Marvel, is a Muslim Pakistani-American teenager from New Jersey. She possess latent Inhuman lineage activated by the Terrigen Bomb. When she was exposed to the Terrigen Mist she became a polymorph with the ability to stretch her body in almost any way imaginable. Kamala was a huge fan of superheroes, especially Carol Danvers, the former Ms. Marvel. She went on to become the newest holder of the Ms. Marvel identity.
abilities: Fatal Blow Durability: Ms. Marvel only needs 2 checks to avoid dying when falling in battle. Once per battle, when receiving a final blow, she won’t fall and will keep 1 HP.
Bioluminescence: Kamala's body emits a glowing yellow energy signature when using her morphogenic powers.
Emergency Pendant: Ms. Marvel uses a special pendant that allows her to call Carol in case of an emergency.
weaknesses: Electromagnetic Pulse Weakness: If Kamala receives an electric or magnetic pulse attack, her elastic powers get decreased. Nova force and power cosmic are also electromagnetic attacks, so this effect applies for those kinds of powers as well. For the next three turns, every power she uses will consume the double power points.

name: Black Bolt
description: Black Bolt was born to two of Attilan's top geneticists, Agon, head of the ruling Council of Genetics, and Rynda, director of the Prenatal Care Center. Subjected to the mutagenic Terrigen Mist while still an embryo, Bolt was born with strange powers surpassing even the Inhumans' norm. A month after being awarded his freedom, Black Bolt discovered his younger brother Maximus in the process of making a treacherous pact with emissaries of the alien Kree. Attempting to stop the Kree ship before it escaped, Bolt used the forbidden power of his quasi-sonic voice to knock the ship out of the sky. When the ship crashed to Earth, it landed on the parliament, killing several key members of the Council of Genetics, including his parents, Agon and Rynda. The reverberations of his brother's shout affected Maximus's sanity and suppressed his nascent mental powers. Despite his guilt and silent protests, Black Bolt was obligated to accept the mantle of leadership of the Inhumans at age twenty. Since then, he is the ruler of Attilan, but is also an ally to many heroes in earth, like the fantastic four.
abilities: Diplomatic Immunity: Black Bolt is the king of Atitlan. He cannot go to jail.
Telepathic Speech: Black Bolt can talk telepathically only with his wife Medusa.

Master Combatant: Black Bolt is also a master of hand-to-hand combat, although even the smallest sigh directed towards most individuals, even those possessing great physical attributes, is enough to destroy them. It is reputed that he once defeated Ikaris the Eternal in one on one hand-to-hand combat with ease.
weaknesses: Speechless: Black Bolt's voice is dangerously powerful. Because of this, he must have great control of his powers, so must his player. The player who is using Black Bolt cannot speak, He can only speak to indicate actions performed by black bolt, but first he must raise his hand. If the player speaks without the master's permission, it would be like if Black Bolt speaks, and he will unleash his Quasi-Sonic scream without whispering, possibly attacking his allies and destroying everything in front of him.

name: Medusa
description: When the Alpha Primitive worker race revolted, Medusa battled their leaders, the Trikon. Her sky sled crashed in the fight and she became an amnesiac wanderer, until the Wizard found her on a small Mediterranean Island, fighting French soldiers. As he was creating an evil version of the Fantastic Four, he needed a woman to join his Frightful Four. Medusa readily agreed and filled out the evil foursome as they tried many times to embarrass and defeat the Fantastic Four. After helping Black Bolt, protecting her kingdom from Maximus, she gained his trust and eventually became his wife and queen of Atitlan.
abilities: Diplomatic Immunity: Medusa is the Queen of Atitlan. She cannot go to jail.
Telepathic Bond: Medusa can communicate with his husband, Black Bolt, telepathically.

name: Crystal
description: Crystal was the second child born to the Inhuman nutritionists Quelin and Ambur. She is considered part of the Royal Family of Attilan. Like her older sister, Medusa, Crystal was subjected to the Terrigen Mist when she was an infant, and the process endowed her with certain mental powers. While she was still a child, war erupted, forcing Crystal and her kinsmen to flee Attilan. Crystal passed through adolescence into young adulthood while wandering with her kinsmen through Asia, Europe, and finally America in search of Crystal's amnesiac sister Medusa. When they finally caught up with Medusa in New York, Medusa had sought refuge with the Fantastic Four, mistaking her kinsmen for her enemies. Crystal then met Johnny Storm of the Fantastic Four and the two began a romantic relationship that survived Crystal's return to Attilan and a lengthy separation. She now serve as part of the Inhuman Royal Family, and helps many superheroes, whenever she is needed.
abilities: Elemental Manipulation: Crystal can control all basic elements of nature; the damage type of her normal attacks will be the same of the damage type of the last power she used.
Elemental Resistance: Crystal is resistant to fire, cold and electric damage.
Diplomatic Immunity: Crystal is part of the royal family of Atitlan. She cannot go to jail.

name: Gorgon
description: Gorgon Petragon was an Inhuman and the son of Korath and Milena, members of the House of Agon, the royal family of the Inhumans. He was cousin to Blackagar and Maximus Boltagon. Exposed to Terrigenesis, he developed a physical mutation in the form of hooves, along with the ability to create kinetic shockwaves. When Black Bolt, Medusa and Maximus fled to the humans' world after an Alpha Primitives' insurrection, Gorgon was challenged into a contest to serve as viceroy in the stead of Kadlec the Seeker who was sent to retrieve the sons of Agon. Gorgon was taught by the Unspoken some advises on the ways to rule. Gorgon fell in love with, and eventually married, a woman named Myrra and had children with her. Myrra eventually died, leaving Gorgon with an everlasting pain inside him. He had a daughter, Alecto (unknown if Myrra was the mother) then, from another mother, a son, Petras Petragon.
abilities: Diplomatic Immunity: Gorgon is part of the royal family of Atitlan. He cannot go to jail.
Lesser healing Factor: Gorgon can heal himself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Natural Fighter: Gorgon is a formidable hand to hand combatant.
weaknesses: Disease and Poisoning: Gorgon is more vulnerable to diseases, because of this, it takes double recovery time for diseases, and he throws in disadvantage when saving against poisoning and this status effects lasts double time for him.

name: Karnak
description: Karnak Mander-Azur is the second son of an Inhuman priest and philosopher named Mander and an ocean biologist named Azur. They sent their first son, Triton, into the Terrigen Mist when he was an infant, rendering him incapable of functioning outside an aquatic environment. Thus, they pleaded with the Genetic Council to raise Karnak without Terrigen mutation. Karnak was enrolled in his father's religious seminary in the Tower of Wisdom, where he trained in various physical and mental disciplines until he was eighteen years old; meanwhile, at some point Azur died in a mysterious undersea mishap Karnak also fathered a son, Leer with an unrevealed woman named at an unknown period of time. He fought against th Fantastic Four, but eventually became their allies.
abilities: Weak Point detector: Karnak can detect the most vulnerable part of an enemy's body. Because of this, he can deal critical hits with a 19 throw.
Diplomatic Immunity: Karnak is part of the royal family of Atitlan. He cannot go to jail.
Contortionist: He is extremely lithe and flexible, able to expand and contract his muscles and contort his body into seemingly painful positions.

Master Martial Artist: Karnak is easily the best martial artist in Attilan and is one of the worlds finest hand to hand combatants, his inhuman speed combined with his fighting ability as well as his ability to find weak spots make him a dangerous and incredibly talented martial artist.

name: Silver Surfer
description: The Silver Surfer is a humanoid alien with metallic skin who can travel through space with the aid of his surfboard-like craft. Originally a young astronomer named Norrin Radd on the planet Zenn-La, he saved his homeworld from the planet devourer, Galactus, by serving as his herald. Imbued in return with some portion of Galactus' Power Cosmic, he acquired vast power, a new body and a surfboard-like craft on which he could travel faster than light. Now known as the Silver Surfer, he roamed the cosmos searching for planets for Galactus to consume. When his travels took him to Earth, he met the Fantastic Four, who helped him rediscover his nobility of spirit. Betraying Galactus, he saved Earth but was exiled there as punishment.
abilities: Immortality: Silver Surfer is essentially immortal. Being immune to aging, poisoning, irradiation, and paralysis. However he can be killed by damaging his body.
Lesser healing Factor: Silver Surfer can heal himself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
Self-Sustance: The Silver Surfer does not need to eat or breathe since he absorbs life-maintaining cosmic energy directly through his skin.

Cosmic Vision: Silver Surfer sight allows him to see farther than any human being. He can change vision between visible spectra, infrared vision, can see signatures / paths of psionic energy, adjusts his vision to continuous brightness, and can see all things up to the “nanoscopic scale”. He is also immune to illusion powers. He is immune to blinding.

Cosmic Hearing: Silver Surfer has a powerful hearing sense that allows him to detect hidden or invisible characters. It has also helped him to detect even skrulls disguised as other species. He is immune to deafening.
Soul Absorption Resistance: Silver Surfer receives half damage to soul attacks. He is immune to soul absorption or consumption.

Cosmic Awareness: Silver Surfer has a cosmic awareness that allows him to comprehend rules of the universe others would find incomprehensible. With this power he is able to detect when there's a terrible menace that can threaten the universe, no matter where it is located. This also makes him invulnerable to surprise attacks.
Bulletproof: Silver Surfer receives half damage from low calliber firearms.

name: Sylvie
description: Sylvie Laufeydottir, born Loki Laufeydottir, is a Princess of Asgard who comes fron another universe and caused a Nexus event as a child which forced her to escape for years from the Time Variance Authority. Sylvie hid throughout the timelines, while seeking revenge against the TVA and the Time-Keepers. On the cusp of her plan's success, however, she was interrupted by another Loki Variant, with whom she eventually formed an uneasy alliance. Having convinced Loki of the TVA's lies and manipulations, they worked together to fight them, discovering the Time-Keepers, the leaders of the TVA, were fakes. With her only ally being Loki, Sylvie followed him into the Void, in the wake of Ravonna Renslayer sending him there, where they eventually found and confronted He Who Remains, the real creator of the TVA. Despite warnings from Loki about the consequences, Sylvie enacted her revenge and killed He Who Remains, causing the Multiverse to expand and Kang the Conqueror to gain power.
abilities: Frost Giant Body: Thanks to her frost giant body, Sylvie is immune to Freezing.
Dark Sorcerer Protection: With her magic power, Sylvie is immune to charming or telepathic control.
Allspeak: Thanks to the Allspeak, Asgardians can communicate and be understood by all races.
Superhuman Longevity: Like all Asgardians, Sylvie ages at a far slower rate than humans.

Master Combatant: Sylvie is a highly skilled and formidable hand-to-hand combatant, being able to fight Loki on equal ground, successfully defeated some of the most skilled warriors of the TVA, and almost effortlessly took down security guards on Lamentis-1.

name: Starfox
description: Eros is the youngest son of two Eternals A'Lars and Sui-San. Originally named Eron, he was rechristened Eros at the age of 5, given his interest in the opposite sex. Eros grew up to be a fun-loving, carefree womanizer in contrast to his brother Thanos, a power-hungry, misanthropic schemer. In his youth, Eros became integrated with the Machine, becoming a true Eternal and increasing their number to 101. While his brother Thanos would later try and fail to achieve the same feat, Eros accomplished it without even trying. The Machine believed this to be a perfect reflection of Eros' personality. While Sui-San attempted to convince her son to stay with the other Earth-bound Eternals, and to redeem the experiment of his parents, Eros felt that he was too young and had lived too little. Only when Thanos launched his first major attack against Titan, an attack that left their mother Sui-San dead, did Eros begin to take life a bit more seriously. In subsequent campaigns against Thanos, Eros fought alongside Titan's handful of survivors. Eros joined the Kree Captain Mar-Vell and the Avengers in the first major defeat of Thanos. Eros lived many other adventures and recently, after some mutant psychics were able to enter the Uni-Mind, and successfully voted Eros to the position of Prime Eternal.
abilities: Immortality: Starfox, like all Eternals, is essentially immortal. Being immune to aging, poisoning, irradiation, and paralysis. However he can be killed by damaging his body.
Feeling good: Thanks to his pleasure stimulation. All allies 25 ft close to him are immune to frightening, charming, confusion and have +1 bonus on any attempted throw.
Multilingual: Starfox can speak English and 100 other different alien languages, he can also speak every language on earth.
Lesser healing Factor: Starfox can heal herself in 1d4 each turn. His dice increases to 1d6 on level 10 and to 1d8 in level 20.
